title: Longtime user of 1Password
text: Longtime user of 1Password. With every update, it gets more useful. Support is quick and they follow up on any issues you encounter.

title: Frozen account despite paid fee.
text: I complained about my account still being frozen despite having paid the annual fee and the team promptly resolved the case with a VERY fast reply.

title: Buy vs. Rent, No thanks to renting
text: 1Password has been a great tool for years. I bought into it when it was a standalone app, with plug ins for all the browsers.  Over time they added an online version to compete with LastPass.  Now they have forced a subscription model on all who bought their software in the past.  I don't want to pay a subscription every month or year for something I want as a standalone app. I don't care about the 50% discount they are offering me quietly and no one else online it seems from within the App on my desktop or iPhone. I just want an app, and i am happy to pay outright or it, around what I paid, after a lot of shouting, the last time. this forced march to a future where everything is rented sux. Read some history, rentiers did not fair well when pitted against entrepreneurs.  Suck me 1Password, I don't like this bending to your will.  I will seek out some open source alternative, or go back to (shudder) an encrypted spreadsheet before I pay you rent.

title: 1Password is just great
text: Date of experience:   September 25, 2022

title: Great support service
text: The support service is really great. They responded very quickly and helped to solve everything as fast and easily as possible.

title: Amazing support team
text: I had downloaded 1password a few months prior to deciding to give it a second try, as I Experienced the exact same issue. Unable to get the imports to show up correctly on each field. Previously, I was using Bitwarden which I was very happy with the ease of use, but it was missing some of the extra features provided by 1password.  Decided reaching out to 1PWD support team for help before giving up once again. I was provided with a few links to show me the way to manually label each field, but I just had too many passwords and the process was extremely time consuming. I replied to support team and I had a reply from a very patient rep who provided a work-around and stayed with me every step of the way.  This was extremely thoughtful and helpful, the rep was committed into helping me get a fair chance at experiencing the product, the way it was designed to be experienced. To date, it has become my Go To password manager, very reliable. Thank you 1PSWD.

title: Totally Recommend 1Password's Support!
text: I've happily used 1Password for a few years, so this isn't the first time I've contacted 1Password Support, and probably not the last. I know Support will save my sanity when I mess up on my computer. This time it involved the upgrade from 7 to 8 and, as often happens, I missed a vital instruction. I contacted Support and within a few email conversations over a few days, everything was up and running correctly with 8.  I want to thank the men and women at 1Password Support for the quick responses, friendly exchanges, and finally, the understanding and easily understandable "fixes" for my issues.  What a great, 5-star crew!

text: I had a question regarding billing on a new account. I finished my 14 day free trial and planned to purchase a one year subscription to 1Password. I had started my trial using a 50% off for a monthly family account. When I went to enter my credit card info, I was being charged the full price for a family plan. During a chat session, I was told that the discount would be on the invoice and not on the credit card screen.

text: I got very responsive service handling a question on the end of my trust and where I had already set up a payment method, but was continuing to get emails telling me the trial was expiring and I needed to set up a payment method. Jenn was fantastic with support that clarified I was all good, just a system issue on repetitive emails. This is a GREAT product and my 1st support experience was equally as good!

title: App keeps you safe and organized but sometimes it's finicky
text: 1password is an app I have used for many years now and is a trusted, secure, and efficient tool I can't operate without. Sometimes the UI is a bit wonky, and when I go to the Help Center FAQ articles to troubleshoot (or contact the Support team), the screenshots don't always look like my app which makes problem solving difficult.

title: I don‚Äôt think I can live without‚Ä¶
text: I don‚Äôt think I can live without 1Password.  I highly recommend it to everyone especially when I see them struggle to remember passwords or have to dig up a post it note.  Everyone needs this to manage the many passwords in our daily lives. I don‚Äôt feel secure using search engines or icloud to store them either. 1Password is the only way to go...

title: Until I was directed to Laura Rooke
text: Until I was directed to Laura Rooke, I was growing increasingly exasperated with Support interactions involving the transition from 1Password 7 to 8. I still believe that much on the cut-and-paste instructions I received were seriously flawed with indefinite references, ambiguity, and vagueness. Also, I think I went through six or seven Support personnel before I was finally directed to Laura, who stayed with me step-by-step and quickly clarified any source of misunderstanding I encountered. Using 1Password 7 I was a loyal, product-confident, and happy client. Product confidence went to zero before Laura. Since Laura I'm back at loyal, product-confident, and happy. My wife is happy, too, which is a relief to me.

title: Excellent Response and Support
text: My questions were pretty basic but the support team handled them quickly, politely and thoroughly.  They also cleared up a number of misunderstandings about how the product worked and where the data is stored.  It was an excellent support experience.

title: I was initially bummed about the‚Ä¶
text: I was initially bummed about the password not being able to be reset.  However, the link to the password help website did jog my memory.  I gave feedback that my issue was simply because I didn't connect that my Master Password to access the account was the same password I had to use every time I accessed my vault.  I literally type that dozens of times per day so adding a note to the "Lost Password" website that these two are one in the same would also likely jog someone's memory.  I felt like a pleb not realizing this myself!  The help was excellent though, and I really appreciated it!

title: I am brand-new to 1Password and was‚Ä¶
text: I am brand-new to 1Password and was nervous about setting it up, and across the arc of a day I sent in three emails with two questions apiece. Each time I got a clear and quick reply. I totally felt guided through the process, and immediately realized 1Password was one of those rare sites with excellent customer support. I am so grateful.

title: Thank you for the fast and professional‚Ä¶

title: Great program...

title: Gets worse with every major release
text: 1Password user for over 10 years. What started as a well build native Mac application has grown to a bloated web app of almost 600MB in size. No longer available in the App store, you have to downoad it and install it, requiring admin permissions. Also, storing your secrets locally is no longer possible, you have to trust they‚Äôre safe in the cloud. It is clear where this app is going, and that‚Äôs not the direction I‚Äôm going. Actively seeking another password manager to replace 1password.

Sometimes it does not save password even when it generates one, requiring one to reset their password.  When it works, it‚Äôs great‚Ä¶but it‚Äôs inconsistent!

My only regret is that we could not make v8 work consistently and so I have reverted to v7. The softaware gets only 1 star. I liked the new features -- but not enough to struggle with having to always re-enter information or have to manually sign on to certain sites.

text: Josh was very patient and helpful.  He could not have been nicer.  Don't hesitate to send 1Password an email you have about an issue with their product. Highly recommend it as the software does a great job, and the company has terrific support.

title: Amazing support. Issue resolved.
text: After upgrading to 1Password 8, the app would only launch in one user account on my computer. I contacted support and went through some troubleshooting steps. We downgraded to 1Password 7 and everything worked fine. We then upgraded to 8 again and did a workaround through Terminal which resolved the original issue. It seemed there was a permission issue they are working to resolve with the next update, but this let me keep on using 1Password 8 until then.  The entire interaction was handled by one support representative which seems rare nowadays. By having only one person helping you, it a much more personal experience. You feel your issue is important, even if it‚Äôs not that big of one.  The prompt replies from 1Password also allowed for a quick resolution, and every troubleshooting step was explained in extreme detail. This made if feel like they were right beside you while working through the issue.  I can‚Äôt express the gratitude I feel for this experience. You usually don‚Äôt have interactions like this with any support teams. In the chance that you do, it changes your view of that business and keeps you loyal with their product. I‚Äôve been a 1Password user since around 2008, and every interaction I‚Äôve had with them has always been amazing.

title: 1Password FTW
text: I've been using 1Password for many years now, and recently my company started using it for our team's password manager.  I had an issue with Windows Hello not working in my Edge extension and Josh at 1Password Support helped sort me out by pointing me towards an Edge policy that was preventing the integration with the 1Password for Windows desktop app from working correctly.  If anyone is having issues with this, ensure NativeMessagingUserLevelHosts is set to true in edge://policy and it'll be like magic!

title: Migration issues to Mac Studio
text: Excellent and very helpful suggestions which allowed me to quickly resolve all issues with1Password during my migration to a Mac Studio computer from an older iMac.  In particular, there was a very prompt response to my concerns with some responses even on Sunday.  Specifics of my problem involved 1PW not opening after my first migration attempt; and the difficulty in getting an Apple Silicon version.  For some reason the installer initially installed an Intel version requiring Rosetta.  With help from 1PW, I received excellent guidance on how to get the Apple Silicon version installed.   Everything is now working well.  1PW is an excellent program which I have been using for about 11 years. Keep up the great work to make 1PW the leader in password management.

title: An offer I couldn't refuse.
text: As a long term user of Lastpass and experiencing some annoying inconveniences which were clearly not being addressed, I read some password manager reviews; 1password was highest recommend, and the mose expensive, as I recall. I decided to opt for a 14 day trial, which for me, a busy, old, grumpy, arthritic and technically  imcompitent creature,  proved insufficient time to attain an adequate degree of confidence to switch from a long term and proven operational system which I knew well how to operate. When I explained this to 1Password's Ms Julia V., they apparently had no hesitation in extending the trial period to about 4 (four) months; I found this to be most surprising,  understanding and professional. Within about 3 or 4 weeks I had attained a sufficient level of confidence with 1Password the make the switchover with ease and conviction. When I informed the 1Password people that I was ready to switch and pay without delay, they graciously maintained the full feeless trial period. Further, as I opted for a 'family' plan because that choice sat comfortably with me, I asked weather or not the 1Password people would agree to me inviting a friend to have a trial period (of unspecified length) as one of my 'family' members, obviously isolated from my information with his own 'personal' vault and benefits. They agreed enthusiastically and immediately. This demonstrates a great company attitude and it enthuses me with confidence which is reflected in their product. It is also a face saver for me as I had tried my password-frustrated friend to try Lastpass; oh how I continue to regret that. A path to redemption has been provided by 1Password. Full marks to 1Password, Julia V, and, of course, the complete management of 1 Password. Sincerely, Peter Kelly.

title: Perfect
text: I started the 1Password free 14 days trial this morning after several hours of benchmarking all password managers and i can already say that i will keep it as my password manager at the end of the free trial. The password manager itself is just perfect. It offers many features and it's very easy to use, even for non-tech people. My favourite feature is about the possibility to create multiple vaults, which is perfect if you have several email adresses or/and if you want to store your logins in different folders. I'll now talk a little about 1Password support. I contacted support by email before starting the free trial to ask some questions.  The support is very fast and provides excellent answers. When it comes to your passwords, it's important to feel backed up by quality support. Thank you 1Password & 1Password support !

title: Pasword manager + Customer service
text: I've been using 1password now for about 6 years. Introduced through work, I've since gone on to pay for a family plan in the vain hope that my wife would find it as convenient as I do. Nope, she just resets her password 57 times a month. The struggle goes on. 1Password 8 is taking a little getting used to but I can see what they are going for and each release gets more polished.  I've enjoyed the availability of PC OS, Mobile OS and web extensions as I tend to use all of these. At work, I'm on a Mac. At home, I use Linux and Windows. I own Android and IOS devices. And all of these get 1password set up as the first thing I do. After doing that, getting into my various accounts is a breeze. I also make use of the automatic 2fa completion and have added a security key to my master account.  I use watchtower to keep an eye on what accounts have been compromised over time and allow the software to help with resetting my passwords. Finally, I submitted a bug and a few questions to the friendly Customer Support team and received great service, with thorough instructions and guidance. Yes, this review is all glowy, but this is my number 1 piece of must-have software.

title: Up and running beautifully on 1Password on all of my devices with 1Password Support!
text: I've been a subscriber of 1Password for the past four years but recently had problems across my MacBook Air, iPad and iPhone after updating to the most recent version. At first I was really frustrated that I was unable able to reach 1Password support by phone but then decided to grit my teeth and try the online chat. Over a period of several days I went back and forth with several support staff who I must say were steady and persistent in solving my problem. It turned out that I had an old email address no longer in use on my account and it was causing problems with updating to the latest 1Password version. Support staff were always very prompt in getting back to me with instructions as to what I had to do each step of the way to correct this. Trevor, the last in my series of support people, was particularly helpful. His instructions were so clear and easy to follow and he always made it clear that I should be sure to contact him if I had problems or questions on moving forward, which I did several times, and his response was immediate and effective in completely resolving my problem.

title: I convince myself to pass from the Paid‚Ä¶
text: I convince myself to pass from the Paid Standalone icloud sync version of 1Password, used for years very well, to the Paid Subscription to enable my family to use 1password too. Purchased the subscription on the 30th of August 2022. Follow the migration guide made by 1Password, and the migration fails after ~70 items. The popup says, do not use onepassword until we contact you. So I open a ticket to try and get support. The person on the support team replies with a bunch of irrelevant questions, depite me having explained in the opening phase the full software scenario leading to the failed move. I they reply to explain again the scenario and look to be assisted (lets remember paid subscription), and all that happens is to be ghosted. No reply ever since, despite me having written multiple times to the support trying to get assistance. Now 6th Sept 2022 and counting, still stuck with un-usable software, subscription was debited to my card and no reply from support. Clearly, there has been a push to subscriptions without clear support resources. Stay clear of this software and use another password manager if you can.

title: An actual useful and convenient app, much better than Chrome password manager
text: When I know this app for the first time, it occurred to me that I already have Chrome remembering password for me, why should I pay for an extra password remembering app? But after I actually tried this app for 14 days, I know i cant leave it right now. Here's why: 1. More organized than chrome     When i use chrome, sometimes it will repeatedly remember my account and username, then afterwards, if i want to login the next time, i will pop up multiple choices which looks a mess. 2. More secure than chrome    As far as i know, chrome do very little encryption on the password, leaving *all* of your password in a ricky situation, and recently one of my "main password" leaked, not knowing who to blame... 3. Cross platform, Cross app (really important)    When i use chrome, it always suggests me to use a auto-generated password, but then i think what the hell am i going to do when i want to type this password in a iphone app? But 1password has no similar problem, it support not only all the web browser but also all the apps in ios, android, mac, windows... 4. Its not that expensive (especially if you're a student)     At first glance it seems 3$ each month is quite expensive, but hey this is our password, this is out privacy, it's worthless! And also if you're a student you can write an email to the support team and they will give you a 50% discount, and now this is really cheap! Oops, i've said so much, now it's time for you to experice it. (first 14 days are free!)

text: Awesome customer service is why I am leaving a review, because the folks at 1Password are great.  I recently tried to update the 1Passsword 8 for Android, version 8.9.3, to no avail. So rather than combing through various other reviews and/or threads to find out what was going on, I just went right to the 1Password website and asked for help.  Almost immediately, I heard from Brendan, who had written to me at great length about what was going on with the app, as well as suggestions to move forward while the app was being tweaked. Shortly thereafter, I heard from Timothy: The app already had been fixed and I could retry/reinstall, etc. Sweet! It all happened super quickly, and the guys were really kind and helpful. I love the changes. We are loyal 1Password users here, so we appreciate their support and dedication to great service and a great product. Thanks, guys!

text: Outstanding App where I save my more than 200 passwords. I must say: the  1Password app is truly phenomenal the customer support is a 100 plus!! They are oh so good and respond immediately. They do everything in their power to resolve any issue you may experience with the app and do their utmost to get you up and running in the shortest possible time. 1Password is, in my opinion the best password keeper ever!

title: Old version AWESOME, new version PATHETIC
text: I had been a happy 1Password customer for over 10 years but have been forced to switch to a new password manager. Over the past 10 years, I had nothing but good things to say about 1Password, but I recently upgraded my Mac operating system to Monterey which no longer supported the old 1Password 6 version, so I figured I would take the plunge and upgrade. I tried to update to 1password 8 directly, but discovered I could not do so, I was instructed to install 1Password 7 to facilitate the upgrade to 1Password 8, but after following the instructions, I still was not able to 1Password 8.  I decided to try running 1Password 7 instead, but kept getting NUMEROUS annoying pop ups to upgrade to 1password 8 every time I used it, and I could not add or edit new passwords. Unfortunately my original version of 1Password was purchased many years ago under an email address I no longer had access to, and it did not have the ‚ÄúSecret Key‚Äù. I tried following the tech support information on their website, but the instructions did not help at all. The nagging reminders and inability to update my passwords or add new ones became more and more frustrating. I tried emailing asking to speak with a tech rep, but was told they do not offer phone support. I was provided more lists of tech support steps, but they did not work. I have made the unhappy decision to part ways with 1Password.  It used to be a fantastic password manager, but the current version is inaccessible to users of previous versions and your tech support is pathetic. I find it incomprehensible they cannot offer phone support for long term paying customers that are willing to pay $36/year to get the new version. I have seen this kind of behavior when small companies go VC funding. I can only deduce their customers are a secondary consideration to short term bottom line profit. Signed,  A customer lost.

title: I had a question about removing‚Ä¶
text: I had a question about removing 1Password from one of my devices, but leaving it on all others. I received a response within 24 hours that had a simple answer and simple instructions. It was excellent customer service.

title: 1Password software and support are excellent!
text: I am a CTO and COO so I review and choose a lot of software. 1Password applications and customer services are some of the best I've used. I've used LastPass for personal use as well as within a company of 250+ for over 10 years: 1Password is SIGNIFICANTLY better in every aspect, including customer service. Most interactions with 1Password team were great, but Dayton stood out. Kept following up until the issue was resolved!

title: Incredible customer experience
text: I recently reached out to 1Password to file a bug report about the newest major revision, 1Password 8, on iOS. I expected the bug report to fall into the ether. Instead, Dave W. from 1Password Support captured my disparate bug reports / feedback submissions into one uber-case and responded to each numbered item with an explanation or ask for further details. Over the course of a week, we corresponded back and forth with clarifying questions and debugging information / repro steps. Throughout this process, I felt that Dave was highly invested in my success as a 1Password customer and highly invested in the quality of his company's workmanship, reputation, and customer engagement. Dave also gave me very technical explanations and advice, which helped me eliminate potential root causes and figure out some mitigations on my end as well. I've been in the tech industry for 8 years now, including 7 years working in the security space (5 years on AI/policy/law/UX to fight social engineering, 2 years on OAuth protocols and cryptography), and having spent my time at Microsoft and Google I've mostly acted in the capacity as the customer service PROVIDER, so I do have some empathy for how difficult the job is. However, I've also had my fair share of being a customer or a partner. From all three of those perspectives - as I already told Dave in the customer support email at the end of our thread - Dave W. provided the best 1:1 hands-on customer support I have ever experienced either as a consumer or enterprise customer. While I've always had a high opinion of 1Password and I am definitely a superuser, Dave's customer support far exceeded any of my expectations.

title: an excellent application...with a terrible customer service process
text: Service provided by agent is helpful, but the process of troubleshooting a technical issue by email is UNNECESSARILY INEFFICIENT! First...because you have to wait a few days for someone to respond, which means the problem remains a problem. Second because the agent might not fully understand the problem, and even if s/he does, it's likely they will need more details...which means you have to repeat and/or add details...which means another 2 - 4 days at least with no resolution.   This email process can take a week or more for resolution!! This is especially frustrating when you know the problem could be resolved with a few minutes of conversation.  The 1Password application is terrific.  The help process sucks.   I'm going to search for an alternative.

title: 1Password support is awesome
text: 1Password support is awesome, I was looking for an opportunity receive a discount as a student for the family plan but unluckily it was not available. I am the only security literate in the household and a family member had their credentials compromised so I was looking towards 1Password as a solution. Although the 1Password Support mentioned that no such discount exists for the family plan, the team member pointed out that as an existing student I am still qualified for the student plan (been a 1P member for 2 years, which I thought the student discount was only viable for one year). As a student (pinching pennies and a focus on CyberSec), I found out about 1Password through Troy Hunt and couldn't have been happier with my choice.

title: Adding passwords is not optimal
text: Adding passwords is not optimal. Unlike other password managers, 1password does not prompt you to save or update your password after a succesful login. Rather, it asks you to save it before you click ‚Äòok‚Äô or ‚Äòsubmit‚Äô. This pulls you away from whatever task you were trying to accomplish. It is especially cumbersome when you are unsure what you password is. Horribly overlooked usability. I have 11 months left on a family plan, that I‚Äôm pretty much going to abandone over this oversight. You‚Äôre better off going with Lastpass which has this feature. EDIT: To answer your reply. Suggested passwords are for when I am CREATING a password, not to save an existing one. It does not address my concern at all. If you are going to reply to my review please read what I actually wrote. EDIT2: I've seen all your steps. I know how to use your software. You're not listening, it's not that I don't know how to do it, it's that your method is cumbersome and unintuitive. All the alternative software does it better. I think the fact that you don't see this problem (even though it has been discussed on your own forums and elsewhere) shows you do not listen to your customers.  There is a better way to add passwords than having to go in your interface and follow all those steps.  As soon as I successfully log into a website there should be a prompts that says "Would you like to update/save this password?" and then I click "YES" and it's done.  This is how Chrome's password manager does it, this is how Lastpass does it, This is how Bitwarden does it, etc. Your method is not good, there are better ways to do it. Assuming that my problem is that I don't know how to use your software seems arrogant.

title: Most Secured Password Manager
text: Simply the best Secured Password Manager exists. 1Password is not just a place to save your log-in information, but a highly secured place to save confidential things like Credit Card details, Social Security numbers, Passport details, Medical Records, API credentials, Software License, and more. One of the major reason why I love 1Password over other similar tools is it will generate an Emergency Kit during sign-up. You have to Add an Emergency Kit secret code along with your Master password to access your 1Password account which makes it impossible to hack a 1Password account.  Your Emergency Kit contains everything needed to sign in to your account on 1Password.com or in the apps.

But more than the superb quality of the product, the customer service of the 1Password team has been nothing short of excellence each time I have reached out to them.  On more than 1 occasion, their team members have taken the time to answer my questions fully and educate me on the specifics of how their product works with regards to my particular question.  Most recently, Ali went above and beyond in illuminating some of my misunderstandings and blindspots regarding 1Password in particular and cyber security in general.  He really answered my questions the way a good professor would in the classroom.  I cannot say enough about the 1Password team and the product they offer the market.  Absolutely outstanding!

title: Courteous response
text: They also responded to me in Japanese. The response was appropriate and very helpful.

title: 1Password is a great product
text: 1Password is a great product. I had a quick issue for customer service and they resolved it in one email. Impressive service on a great product.

title: Quick and polite customer care
text: I contacted 1Password support to make a change to my account. The response was fast and polite and as usual, they show that they care about their customers.

title: Must-Have Digital Life Protection Service
text: This service is number one on my required monthly payments list, and for good reason. Your digital life is nearly equivalent to your physical life, so wouldn‚Äôt it be a great idea to have it protected to the best of your ability? However, being vigilant about protecting your online life is a huge hassle, but not with 1Password. Whether it be storing your passwords, credit card numbers, or other sensitive information, 1Password provides an easy-to-use and thoughtfully created platform for managing all that data. Thinking up passwords and having them stolen because they were too simple will be a thing of the past. Even better is that there‚Äôs a family plan! Having everyone you love use the service you need to keep your online life safe and secure definitely gives you peace of mind. Hope you try it out and enjoy it as much as I have and still do!

title: It took a bit of time to come to the‚Ä¶
text: It took a bit of time to come to the right conclusion but the Help Desk stuck with it until we resolved the issue.  I appreciated that.

title: Super helpful interaction

title: You need a password manager, 1Password is excellent
text: I‚Äôve been telling people for years that they need a password manager. 1Password is always my first recommendation.

title: I requested instructions to help me fix‚Ä¶two accounts
text: I requested instructions to help me fix that I ended up with two accounts‚Ä¶one personal and one on my wife‚Äôs family account. Although there was an attempt by very friendly communications, my situation was never resolved. I ended up creating two personal accounts, one for me and one for wife which is not the most cost effective. Wanted to speak to someone‚Ä¶not available.

title: My experience with this app has been awesome, up until the point I learned that there wasn't a free version....
text: My experience with this app has been nothing but 5 stars, and then I decided to make an account, not realizing that I could not simply "use this program for free", so I reached out to support, and they were so incredibly helpful, and I have no issues with them, the app, or anyone else.  I'm only displeased because I would have to buy a subscription to continue using my account. I know this probably wouldn't bother some people, but that stuff adds up, and I already forget to record Planet Fitness when it comes out of my bank account. I don't need another sneaky subscription trying to take more than it says it will from my account, and I don't want the hassle of trying to cancel it. As of now, I'm "packing up my toys, and going home." I can find an alternative just the same.  I do not hate this service, or this brand, but they shouldn't be forcing people into buying things that they may not want. At the end of the trial period, 14 days, my account would freeze, and I wouldn't be able to add any new entries. When I spoke to support, they were willing to give me two months of trial period to explore my options, but they told me there was no free option, and I couldn't find the area where I could export my data, so I'm "cleaning up my toys now before I'm locked out from them." If you don't want to be forced into a subscription, get out while you can. If that doesn't bother you, this service was fantastic! Support was very friendly, they responded to my inquiry within at least an hour of me reaching out to them. This app is really good if you need a secure place for your passwords. They have everything you need!  I've no complaints beyond the forced subscription buying, but, other than that, I have no complaints!

title: Fast, concise and helpful support!
text: 1Password has one of the best and most professional customer support experiences that I know of. Fast, concise and helpful. They solved my request like a breeze and I even had fun in the conversation.

Upon contacting Support I was surprised to learn I could not speak with a technician but that all would occur through email. To my delight, this worked beautifully and it was a great relief to not be talking on the phone to someone with a heavy accent.  I was able to print your email and refer to it as I was working through the problem.  You were patient and your instructions were clear.  Thank you for your assistance.  I‚Äôm very happy to have 1Password back.

title: I Trust It
text: There are times when I think that 1Password‚Äôs interface is more cumbersome than it needs to be, but the bottom line is simple: It works. I trust it and I rely on it for my internet security. It allows me to store all kinds of sensitive information in a highly accessible but hack-resistant database. It allows me to enter a username and a unique high-strength password for every website I frequent. In many cases, it does that for me. All I have to do Is click on the URL: 1Password does the rest. (Why this procedure works better on some sites than others, I don‚Äôt know.) I can get to my library of information from any computer or other device any time I need to.  I do have one request: 1Password stores my sensitive information in a number of different ‚Äúcategories‚Äù: log-ins, credit card numbers, and so on. I often wish it were possible to convert an item in one category to an item in another, but the only way to do this is to create a new item (in the desired category), cut and paste the old information into it, and then delete the old item. Laborious, but I suppose there‚Äôs a good reason for this limitation.

title: I made a big mistake with 1Password.
text: I made a big mistake with 1Password. I have used it for a while and decided to buy it so hit the buy button. Then decided I should have got a family account, couldn‚Äôt see how so started a family account. I didn‚Äôt get the emergency kit sorted and couldn‚Äôt get back into the new family account only my single account. So I got in touch with the company who helped me sort my problem out with about 4 emails back and forth ( from 4 different people) . Interestingly I was given instructions how to resolve the issues myself, they cannot access my accounts. I had paid for two accounts and once I cancelled the problem account they immediately refunded my payment.  What a great company to deal with, many thanks to the team at 1Password. To finish the software is great, safe and easy to use. Thanks team!

title: 1 Customer Service & follow up
text: I can not speak more highly of the customer service I received from the team at 1Password, and Marcus in particular. I got myself into a huge lather over getting cracking with this product and didn‚Äôt pay due attention. In the end I turned to customer service and I ended up deleting my old account and establishing a new one. At each step I had a follow up email to ask if I was managing to complete the task (I am a self-admitted Luddite when it comes to this sort of thing) in a satisfactory way. The steps offered by way of instruction were logical and easy to follow - without being patronising. The thing that impressed me the most was the personalisation of the whole affair. I would be hard pushed to think of a time when I‚Äôve received better service - service that was so personalised. I could not recommend this team and this product more highly and I would urge anyone thinking about signing on to do so asap.

title: I've tried the others, this is the winner!
text: I've tried several other password managers and this is by far the most well-integrated and easy to use.  It's just smart enough to be useful but not intrusive, and the UI is straightforward and easy to understand.  Also, the security is top-notch, so I'm not worried about their system being hacked/leaked.  I continue to have positive experiences with the product on several platforms (Windows, Mac, iPhone, Android) and recommend this to all my friends and family!

text: I often find that support specialists assume a level of knowledge that I don't have. But that was not the case with the 1Password Customer Support Specialists who handled my case. They gave me very clear instructions, and I was able to do what I needed, without problems.  It was a wonderful experience! I think anyone who is unclear on something in 1Password shouldn't hesitate to contact Customer Support.

title: Straying customer brought back by excellent customer service
text: I've used 1Password since 2012. I had a licence for a standalone version of the app and thought that was the only way of having 1Password, but learned recently there's a subscription version. I don't like subscriptions; I'd rather own an app than rent it; I turn away from subscription apps because I wouldn't get as much use out of them to be worth a monthly fee. For this reason, and because, as an owner of the standalone version, I was deprived of the benefits of the subscription version, I was starting to look elsewhere. In an exchange of emails with a chap at 1Password, I realised I use 1Password every day, probably more than I notice, as it's very convenient and so well integrated in iOS and macOS. This, and my belief that it is still the best password manager there is, persuaded me the subscription is worth it, indeed cheap for all the use I get out the app. Moreover, the subscription is charged annually, which is better than more frequent monthly charges. I was offered a surprisingly good inducement to continue with 1Password with an account rather than with a licence for a standalone version. The process of switching from the licensed version to the subscription version was smooth, well explained and straightforward. I've used their customer services only twice in eleven years and it was beneficial and satisfying both times. It's an excellent app at a bargain and the customer service is to be envied by other companies.

text: I am new to 1Password and during the transfer of data from LastPass to 1Password, I ran into issues.  The LastPass export was not providing all of my data.  So I reached out to 1Password Customer Service and they were very helpful.  Alex in particular, understood my issue right away and provided me with very detailed instructions that worked like a charm.  Couldn't be happier.

title: Frustrated
text: I have been using 1Password for several years, but every time they update seems they want more money for little difference in performance and improvements.  Now my 1Password ver 7 keeps telling me to download ver 8, but when I click on it, nothing happens, probably because 1Password wants more money.

title: Immediate resolution
text: Responded to my question with 2 minutes and sorted the problem immediately.  First Class!

title: Solid C
text: Solid C I've used LastPass and 1Pass. LastPass felt like it was able to fill in things the best, and captured / generated passwords in the easiest and fastest way. On the other hand, 1 pass has a much more professional feel to it, even if you end up copy/pasting individual usernames and passwords in both mobile and desktop environments. It also does a good job of capturing and filling in those short Authenticator passwords. I hope they continue to make the interface easier and more direct to use.

title: Super disappointed in 1password
text: So far, I find this product horrible.  It is just impossible to figure out how to set up my.1password.  The instructions never fit what I see on my computer or phone.  It is super difficult to know whether you have set up the browser, the browser extension, and so many other things.  Even the video but an outside person 1password recommends for set up help is super unclear. I am usually capable of setting up new apps but not this one.  And, I see no real place where one get get personal help.  Just lists of "problems" they can address with an on-line paragraph.  None of these address key challenges.

text: Love this app, it has made a huge difference to my life! Everything is organised now and I don't have to stress about where to find information, passwords etc, I store it all in one place

title: 1Password needs to be able to float on‚Ä¶
text: 1Password needs to be able to float on top and also allow better sorting of Favorites where there is no alpha divider. Who needs a divider? The purpose of Favorites is to have a list that is as short as possible on the screen. Not LONGER because there are dividers.

title: Very worth the cost and effective
text: Started 1Password about 3 years ago.  As a real estate broker there are many passwords needed across all the work applications, not to mention all my personal applications.  1PW has been a game changer and saved countless hours looking for passwords, secure notes, setting new logins, etc. And it works all my devices: tablet, phone and dektop. Worth every cent

title: Genuinely Useful
text: This product is genuinely useful. It syncs across all my devices easily, collects all my logins and passwords, and leaves out the need to remember a million passwords across different sites by just requiring to type in your one master password. Before I had all my passwords stored in the google password manager - they were mainly weak and reused passwords and were vulnerable if my google account was compromised. But now by migrating everything to 1Password, everything feels much more secure and reliable, it's a breeze to use, and all for a low price.

title: Fantastic product, just a few improvements needed
text: This product is fantastic and our organization really finds it helpful. That said there are a few quirks about how it interacts with SOME, but not all, iOS apps--requiring opening the app and copying username/password to be pasted into the app. There also are some glitches when trying to create a new login where the site requires username and password selection in consecutive windows. Still, much improved over other PW management efforts we have tried.

title: Individual to Family - done right!
text: Reached out for a challenge on converting a subscription from individual to family and it was seamless.  I would recommend that this become something that is more "self service" in the future understanding that there are complexities with the apple store and google play store around that.  The response through support was very fast and specific which I completely appreciate.

title: SKal
text: I use it across 3 devices and have a shared account as well. All account passwords that I use are now much more complex and I am able to log-in with just one complex password I use for 1P

title: Long time user.  Has never failed me

title: 1P Works great! Exactly what I was looking for!
text: After several years in the travel industry with a staff of 3-5 people, I really needed something to help our team manage our daily used passwords, securely. 1Password was the best fit for me. I tried LastPass and Dashlane, but the learning curve was much easier with 1P. Even my husband has gotten the hang of it! Works great on our iPhones, and has definitely made our workdays more productive and secure. Thank you for such a great product, 1Password! üéâ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠êüéâ

Thanks.

text: The service level from 1Password is far beyond my expectation.There is never an email sent by me that goes unanswered. They truly understand the value of a customer and what steps they need to take to keep one. Truly a professional, customer provider. I would highly recommend them to anyone looking for a Password Manager

title: Great support

text: I recently reached out to 1Password support team for my account recovery. The process was a long one, although that‚Äôs what it should be in my opinion for utmost security. The support team was very helpful, prompt, friendly and professional - guided me through all the steps very well and clarified all my queries.  One suggested area of improvement, not for the support team specifically, but overall - the payment method. It should have PayPal/ Apple Pay/ Click 2 Pay or similar options; entering card information directly is perhaps a bit risky.

title: 1 Password is reliable, easy to use and their support team is TOP KNOTCH!
text: I am a huge fan of 1 Password. It is easy to use software that my family can use and feel like our data is secure. I recently made a mistake by deleting a family member account/data. The 1 Password customer support is stellar. They worked with me and were able to recover the deleted data within a few days. What a relief. I highly recommend 1 Password for your data security/password needs.

title: Quick response and support
text: Quick response and support! Best password app ever.

title: Account locked - Password failed
text: I could not log into my account (lost password). My request for help from the Support team was prompt, concise and helpful. We deleted my account, created a new one, and my payment account was credited for time lost while the app was unusable.  Great team = great support!!!  Now I can use and set up 1Password to keep my confidential information private, safe and easily accessible only to me, when needed! Thanks!

title: Problem Solved Despite Some‚Ä¶
text: Problem Solved Despite Some Frustration. After a week and working with numerous support people, I was able to resolve my issue. It was a frustrating experience in that some days there would be 1 response/email from the support team. I would do what they asked, reply with the information they requested and wait to hear back. Having said that, I give the support staff credit for continuing to work with me to resolve my problem. And, towards the end I began to get responses more quickly. I wonder if the time gaps in response time is due to a reduced staff (perhaps due to covid) or an overwhelming amount of support requests. I also wonder if the problem might have been resolved more quickly if I had worked with the same support person throughout the process providing more consistently.

title: Super helpful and responsive
text: Super helpful and responsive! We emailed back and forth and they resolved my issue very quickly, even while working with multiple customer service agents.

title: 1password is absolutely #1
text: 1password is an incredible, effective, secure, and easy to use password manager. They set the standard for all password managers to follow! Integrates across all operating systems and mobile phones, 1password is the best way in the world to keep your personal information secure. Make sure you use a long, very long, master password.

title: The product and customer service
text: The product is great, and so is the customer service. I am a curious person. I tend to ask a lot of questions. Even when I ask a question that may seem a little out there, customer service is always polite, informative and fast. If I could have given 1Password 6 stars I would have.

title: 1Password ‚Äì Good software, excellent customer support
text: 1Password as a software is really great.  When there was an issue with my subscription however, I started to panic, as I rely on 1Password heavily in may daily tasks. I contacted their customer support and was not only treated very nicely, but with their help everything was resolved within seven hours (and to the fullest of my satisfaction). Seven hours from my first email until the issue was resolved; now that's impressive. Hands down the best customer support I ever had contact with. I hope I do not encounter any more issues on my way using 1Password, but if I do, I know where to find excellent help.

title: Been a 1Password customer for years
text: Been a 1Password customer for years - Originally I'd bought the product outright but then they moved to a subscription model and so have been on v7 and 8 since they were released. I've also used Nordpass and Lastpass - 1Password is head and shoulders above any other password manager I've used. The vaults, password generator, watchtower feature - all incredible! Use it to store passwords, card info, IDs, router password, etc, etc, etc. Wouldn't ever move away. Also used the support recently as I was experiencing a bug with the password generator not copying from the extension, and everybody who helped me (Josh Davila, Lydia H, Dayton) were super forthcoming and helpful!

title: 1Password ‚Äì Indispensable Product, Invaluable Service
text: I'm an IT technician at a major university. 1Password a godsend for many of my users (who have to juggle many, many accounts. 1 Password makes this experience seamless ‚Äì I can rest easier knowing that my users have unique, randomized passwords for each individual account, and my users can rest easier knowing that they only ever have to remember their master password. The browser plugins work great, and the cloud storage and mobile apps mean that they never have any problems accessing passwords if they don't have their laptop handy. I also want to commend 1Password's customer service. They helped out one of my users (an emeritus professor who is *brilliant* but sometimes struggles with memory) and gave him advice that was kind, professional, and exceptionally helpful ‚Äì I couldn't have helped him better myself. Five stars from top to bottom; truly a gem.

text: I asked for assistance on how I could upgrade my Individual account to Families since I couldn't do it myself with a Google Play Subscription. The support team that provided the assistance were all very accommodating. It may not seem much, but the smileys on their response goes a long way. Through their help I was able  to achieve what I wanted, and I am really grateful for that. Thank you 1Password support team! Keep it up!

title: Fast & great support!

text: I've been using 1password stand alone for years.  I finally bit the bullet and moved over to the subscription family plan.  Catherine in UK support helped make sure I got the discount and that the migration of my existing data was smooth. It was seamless...

title: Fantastic password manager and great‚Ä¶
text: Fantastic password manager and great customer service. Prompt to respond and solved my query with minimal fuss.

title: 1password gets full marks
text: 1password gets full marks as a product and as a customer service champion. I loved my interaction with CS at 1password. The responses were fast, human and helpful. Thank you!

title: 1Password was introduced to me by a friend, as per above comment.
text: 1Password was introduced to me by a trusted friend, helped with set up and left me to move my passwords from a spreadsheet into the security of this smart system. It has been a process of gaining confidence in using a repository which can auto load critical data into web site settings. It just works. And has eased anxieties about trusting such a system. A recent payments issue had me seeking assistance; I was somewhat amazed at the speed and detail of the support, and from no less than 4 people (Yasmina, Zach, Karen, and Saif) who handled the issues, gave me confidence and with some rapid to and fro, with guidance at every step, the problem got sorted. Came down to a sort of midstream change of card details which had been overlooked and some doubled up accounting. The update process gave confidence, was stress free. If the team approach is 1P's way, then it sure works. Thanks.

title: Not just a tool, but a faithful friend for every occasion
text: Imagine a world where you don't need to take with you tons of keys, cards, documents or whatever you'd need to "get by" when venturing out, but a single "access card". The Internet can  be such a world if you have 1Password by your side. Undoubtedly one of the best companions you can have in your daily life. 1Password is so good in it's proposal that once you start to use it, man... You just don't want to go back to a life without it. Don't believe it? Give a try. It's free! It will blow your mind.

title: Canceling Paid Subscription w/o Issue
text: I signed up for a 1Password plan after many years of using the app as a repository for user id/password secure keeper and to now use the software for its real intention and safety features. However, although I signed up a few months ago, I simply have not had time to learn how to use the app properly. I initiated contact with customer support yesterday asking about the cancellation process. The reps were very helpful and although they wanted to know the reason for canceling and attempt to keep me as a paying customer, they were not pushy at all and simply wanted feedback to make the service better. I explained 1Password has not done anything wrong and it was my personal reason as to why I want to cancel. The remaining balance was credited today and this has been a positive experience. Regardless, I highly recommend 1Password.

title: It all worked out fine
text: It all worked out fine.  I took a little more time than I hoped, and I was a little confused by one direction, but I figured it out.  I still don't know why the problem occurred, and it would be good to understand that.

title: First Class Experience
text: First class experience.  Each team member was exceptionally kind and helpful.  Our family has had great success using this password platform and we recommend it.  Knowing the people who represent them care about their customers just make the commitment so much better.

title: Great support
text: I wasn't happy when I had to upgrade from a stand-alone license to a subscription. And the transition from 1PW6 to 1PW7 was difficult for me. However, the product works very elegantly and I can't say enough for the prompt and patient (actually one guy on the phone got a little impatient with me...but at least I was talking to a human) support I received with that initial frustration and less critical questions I've since had.

title: Good app & nice support
text: The support was very kind and understood any of my need. And further more, they could response to it. I‚Äôm very glad of 1Password and their support.

title: Excellent Customer Service
text: I've been a daily user of 1Password for almost 10 years now, yet I only recently discovered the excellence of their support team. I wanted to upgrade to the Family Plan, but had a question prior to me doing so. I emailed the support team and received a reply within one hour. The reply was not only timely, but answered my unique question accurately. This was not a one time thing, as I had a second question a couple of days later and experienced the same type of response. Excellent customer service along with the best password manager! Cheers!

title: Sign-up death loop
text: Can't even access the account I have paid for because of a useless death loop. How am I supposed to log in if I don't have my secret key, and how am I supposed to access my secret key if I have to be logged in?

title: 5 star service
text: Amazed by the quick response and precise and detailed resolution. Felt like a concierge service rather than a typical customer support. Keep rocking folks.

title: Cannot access my account
text: The 1Password helped me regain control of my account. Proactive, responsive and very helpful team. Highly recommended.

title: Really great customer service
text: Really great customer service. However, I think 1Password should have a service for people who forget their master passwords. The application prompts you to change your password when it's old, but then when you do it, if you forget it, you are out of luck. (I have had my password for 5 years when I changed it). I don't think people should get locked out like that, there should be an option to recover.

title: Prompt and very helpful
text: Prompt and very helpful.  Support answered my specific questions with easy to understand instructions - and back up and running.  Great product and great service.

title: I'm quite satisfied with my interactions.
text: I'm quite satisfied with my interactions. In particular, your responses are timely and contain the info necessary to assist me in solving the various problems I have been having. I am a novice with 1Password and feel I am gaining the experience I need to make use of the password app. Thanks for the assistance you have provided,

title: 1Password review

title: Customer Service at a High Level
text: Paul Martin's professional and attentive response to my question about how to set up a login with custom fields for a library checkout webpage was extraordinary. He immediately let me know he understood the problem. His tone and words were warm and encouraging. He got back to me quickly with an initial solution and detailed guidance on how to set up the login, including helpful videos showing me what he had done. After emailing him about a glitch with one of the four custom fields, he then created an even simpler, more elegant solution that solved the problem completely.  The problem I had been having for so long logging into that library website was not that time-consuming, but it WAS frustrating and annoying every time I had to check out a book. His solution works so brilliantly that I have found myself going back to that library site a few extra times just to watch that new1Password login work so perfectly!  This is customer service at a high level and tells me a lot about 1Password as a company. On a scale of 1 to 10, I would give Paul a score of 20+!

title: It's a keeper
text: From all my investigations, 1 Password was the best choice for my password manager. I use it on my desktop PC, laptop PC, iPhone, and an iPad. It syncs passwords across all these devices in an instant.  The thing that I like about 1Password is that it can be set up to use a PIN for opening the application on either a windows or apple device. It is very easy to open and use.  But when any devices are shut off, it will require the master password and then use the PIN until the next reboot. This makes it more secure.  I like the watchtower function that tells me when my passwords are weak or repeated.  I still have to strengthen some passwords.   The beauty of having a Password manager is that I don‚Äôt have to make up easy to remember passwords.  I can make them long and complex (or use a suggested password) because 1Password handles all the passwords for me. The one installation issue that I ran into was that I was already using an older free limited version of 1Password on my iPad and IPhone. When I installed the new version onto all my devices, the passwords would not sync on the iPhone or IPad.  This was very frustrating.  I tried everything.  Then I contacted customer support. They responded via email within two days (over the 4th of July). They explained the issue and how to resolve it.  I worked perfectly.  Other than that, installation was easy. I now feel confident that my passwords are secure and can be easily accessed.

title: I had problems upgrading to 1Password8

title: Bad start now loving it
text: I bought 1Password a year ago following an extensive review in the NYT Wirecutter. I have been using SplashID for the past 12 years. My initial experience was not good as importing my 400 plus entries from SplashID was problematic, with each csv entry requiring manual modification. So I gave up and started painfully reconstructing my database from scratch. This was not fun but I then noted an upgrade to V8 was available. I installed it and tried to import again from SplashID. Voila, a perfect transfer of all my records! I am sold. The program is fantastic and tech service is fast and responsive. The NYT was right, this program is the best.

text: I was confused on how to invite other family members. I first went to the Support page on that topic but it did not solve my particular issue. The specialist clearly understood my misconception and stepped me through the process using very helpful screen shots. It turns out my mistake was trying to invite a family member through the Mac app rather than using the website. This is the third time I have reached out to 1Password Support on various issues and I have been so impressed with their timeliness, their effective communication skills, and their willingness to help users of all ability levels. A nice touch is how the specialists are adept at encouraging you to reach out. They really want you to succeed! I definitely feel like there is a team behind the scenes who are there for me.

title: Awesome 1Password Support and Product
text: The 1Password support is the best password management support I've ever interacted with. I've had a few paid password managers over the years and by far they are the most knowledgeable and most friendly. Even when I ask questions they have documented they still end up providing me extra steps and help. They also really have great follow up. Beyond that the product is awesome. I've never had a problem, it's always been more of a how to do this weird thing I want to try question and they still come through with awesome answers.

title: Amazing support and service
text: I have received amazing and very generous support from Catherine F. I cannot recommend highly enough the generosity they have offered me as a customer, as well as reassuring me with all the steps required and answering all my questions so thoroughly. The service is very timely in getting back to me to considering we are in different time zones too.

title: Reliably. Comfortable. Safely. Available
text: I have been using the program for many years now. Since 2011. Since then, I have never had to look for an alternative, since the functionality of this program suited me completely. The main thing that I have developed is the habit of creating crazy 10-12 digit passwords without fear of losing them. Thank you so much for your product and desire to make this world a safer place.

title: My best experience of a password manager so far!
text: I'll highly recommend. Their software is really well done, - I'm using it on Windows, macOS and Android - it's snappy, native, easy to use and feature-rich. Security-wise, I'm satisfied with the various 2FA login methods offered - using fingerprint, Window Hello, smartphone or more. I appreciate storing more than just passwords and good to mention that their customer support is knowledgeable and responsive.

title: Very helpful and responsive support‚Ä¶
text: Very helpful and responsive support team. Following the reset flow was just a couple of clicks in between email and browser! Well done dudes and dudettes!

title: Thank you for your good support
text: I trusted the security in the pre-purchase survey, but the support system was unknown. The other day, I was inadvertently in trouble and fell into need of support. They responded perfectly and very kindly to my anxiety. Thanks to their support, all of my devices are now properly managed and very easy to use. Thank you to all the support teams for their kind support! I want to use this product for a long time.

title: I had a few teething pains and brought‚Ä¶
text: I had a few teething pains and brought them to customer support. They provided clear and fulsome guidance on how to resolve the issues including providing a guideline on how to maximize use of 1password!

title: Excellent customer support
text: Migrated from 7 to 8 which was relatively easy but then wanted to change servers and migrate data from one to another which I was a bit trickier. The customer support team at Agilebits has always been very responsive and helpful and were again in this case. They quickly helped me to do this and all is good.

title: Awesome experience
text: Great customer service. The billing and support team (Yasmina, Zahra) were very fast and helpful.

text: 1 Password team were very helpful in navigating through the unusual? complexity of a different email address being used in my new Eero Secure+ subscription. Zach explained that emails advising that the 1Password subscription had been cancelled could be ignored - as it was the way he had used to transfer to the new subscription. All in all a good experience. Thanks to all who assisted me. Allan

text: I had been experiencing trouble getting 1Password 6 to interface with Chrome. I found a Redit thread addressing the issue. I saw there was a special promotion for long time users who were disappointed a subscription was now required. I inquired about it and 4 hours later I was up and running with 1Password 8 (family version). The promotion seemed reasonable and the assistance I was offered was appreciated. Turned out the directions were good, so I was able to do it all myself.

title: Great software as well as customer support
text: Have the loved the software for some time now, but this was my first experience reaching out to customer support for help. Their reply was fast, friendly, and (most importantly) solved my issue. Would definitely recommend.

title: Solved the problem
text: Solved the problem.  Not only that, they stayed in touch until they knew it was fixed.

title: Getting 1Password Working Again
text: It took multiple emails, but each one was a logical step. The reps were patient, informative and friendly.

title: The best app ever
text: Date of experience:   June 22, 2022

title: The whole package
text: I have used 1password for YEARS and have recommended it on several occasions but always based on the core product.  Today, it's about support for the product.  Here's the scoop.  After many years of bailing out my husband, son etc. when they get themselves locked out of some account I thought why am I do this?  I set up a family account.  At some point my son told me he can't access it anymore, I assumed user error in setting up the account, put it on my list of things to resolve and life got in the way.  Many months later the annual fee came out and it prompted me to reach out.  Turns out I created two accounts and was paying for the one with no data in it.  No problem, I can help she says.  Hahaha.  I thought, what are the 18 hoops I need to jump through?  I will send some options she says and did.  Life gets in the way.  Weeks later I pick an option.  I will send instructions she says and did.  Life gets in the way.  Weeks later I read the email and see she did all the work in the background and all I had to do was follow the steps.  Clear steps.  There was not one point where I thought where is that? what does that mean? how do I access? what box do I click?  It's not about the "template".  Every email was personal and tailored to my individual situation.  I didn't know that still existed.  A product is a product but your people make the difference.  She could have asked what took so long, why didn't you pick an option, made assumptions that the delays were a choice but passed no judgement, just provided the support in a genuine and authentic way.  Kind is cool.  Bravo.

title: I reported my 1Password account still‚Ä¶
text: I reported my 1Password account still shown as Frozen despite my subscription was completed. I got the reply with very clear steps promptly to assist on my account.   My account got activated anyway as the issue was due to some delay after my subscription. Thank you.

title: Easing my anxiety
text: Dealing with any form of technology is like diving into a deep, dark cave for me.  One Password has always been a breath of fresh air.  They respond quickly and clearly to my inquiries.  I greatly appreciate their services and professionalism!

title: This is worse by the day
text: This is worse by the day, can't even share logins with my family via airdrop now!

title: A 1Password update removed 1Password!
text: I clicked on a 1Password pop-up offering to update my copy.  Instead 1Password was removed from my machine.   It took several interactions, and a break for the weekend, but 1Password support guided me through the steps to recover.  I could not reach password protected websites during this time.  But my passwords were not lost. So support is good.   But 1Password testing missed a major bug. Fortunately the bug removed only the app, not my many, many passwords. (Watch out for the next bug. Figure out how to backup your passwords safely. Best back up to a removable device, like a USB "thumb drive."

title: 1Password Offers Top Notice Customer Service, Amex does Not!
text: After having troubles with Amex regarding a promo refund, and the never ending challenges of calling, texting, and calling more.  I went to the company who I signed up for, through the Amex app.  They were far more attentive and caring with customer relations that than Amex was in any call or text.  1Password listened to my concerns and worked with me to get a results I would be pleased with.  The understood the situation and agreed to help, even when Amex would not honor what they advertised. Their customer service (Kristen) went out of their way to ensure the customer was happy, which is much more than Amex did. My advice to anyone who is in a similar situation.  Drop Amex, then sign up with 1Password, not only different products, but totally different customer focused service.

title: Excellent work
text: How can you tell if the software you're using has an issue, or is it something else you're using the culprit, or maybe you are the culprit? Well, that was the dilemma a few days ago for me. 1Password works flawlessly, I have been trusting the company for a long time already, with their earliest versions. Having to remember just that one password you've etched into your soul is wonderful, the rest, you let the app make up, manage, even suggest or warn you to change some of.   A few days ago, I noticed I couldn't retrieve information under a specific part of 1Password, under the Documents category.  That's an odds & ends for me, I keep images, information saved as a snapshot, or scan, with gibberish that once in a while a specialized website might ask as a second factor authentication.   Trying on different devices I was having pretty much the same result getting somewhat worried thinking how could I retrieve the info and go on.  (It turns out that the integrity of the information was safe & sound in my vault, since I could download those files from 1Password.com - That's a big plus, proving peace of mind under a catastrophic scenario - that is if you remember what you etched into your soul of course) That's when Tech Support kicks in.  That's the serious business behind the big names.  Having worked for some fabulous companies, as tech support engineer, it's easy to understand all the effort that makes the solid bedrock of any company.  Selling a product, any product, is a first step in a business process.  Aftermarket is what keeps the product, the customers, and the manufacturers in a long lasting venture hopefully.  1Password definitely passed the test with my issue.  They asked me to do some tests, and they managed to easily pinpoint the problem, that turned out to be on my side, since I had some strict settings in my network that were preventing 1Password Manager to do it's magic. Problem solved, and everybody happy.  I'm glad this wasn't a software issue, thus reinforcing how solid their product has been through all the years I started using their product. This review is a word of Thanks to everybody at 1Password, an encouragement to keep the spirit, to keep the commitment,  and to keep doing what they definitely do best.

title: Fantastic support from Catherine F
text: Fantastic support from Catherine F. out of the UK. I had a problem with duplicate logins and it was sorted by her in no time.

title: Impressive support in response to some issues I raised
text: I recently sent in some feedback about some problems we were experiencing with auto fill and log-ins.  I honestly wasn't expecting much to come of it, but within a few days, I had received both an automatic acknowledgement, and then a detailed response to my issues, with several recommendations for their solution, from Kevin Li on the support team.  A real person! He had clearly looked into it, and one of my problems was resolved immediately once i followed his recommendations.  The other issue was improved, but not completely solved.   I let Kevin know as an "FYI".  Within another day, I received another email from him detailing additional investigations he had done into the issue, and some more thoughts on how to work around it. I am extremely impressed with the support I experienced.  Next time I have an issue, I will let them know right away because I realize I will receive an informed and helpful answer in a timely manner.

title: FANTASTIC SUPPORT & HAVE LOVED THE PROGRAM FOR MORE than 20 yrs!
text: I have used 1Password, first a free standing license purchase so many years ago, then had to purchase a newer free standing license for personal & business use , also used for many years. I have never been disappointed. It has never failed me EVER. There were a few emails on rare occasion with small issues and questions, but always got the help. Now, recently, for more safety and in estate planning if I become incapacitated and can't do my affairs myself, I was definitely advised to not use the free stand alone license and migrate over to 1Password.com with yearly membership. The help took a couple of days to get back about all the questions I had, but once that got started with the free trial to try, the emails continued back & forth, but always got more help with each one, all questions answered. I can't say enough about this program, and by the way, I have the download for mac and app for iphone, so all for Apple. It is the #1 recommended for Apple. All my goals for what I wanted to accomplish have been met.

title: Wow!
text: I wrote 1Password support on Friday morning.  Julia V. replied to my inquiry early Sunday morning.  Wow, early Sunday morning!  Who works early Sunday morning?  People that are committed and believe in the service they are offering, such as Julia.  Her response was clear and answered the question I asked.  I was impressed. Then I had a follow-up question on Monday morning, after I had created a 1Password account.  Within 90 minutes, Julia V. responded.  Again, her response was clear.  She detailed the steps that I should take (this time with screen shots and arrows).  Again, I was impressed. Julia V. has made a believer out of me.  Yes, she is promoting a good product.  No doubt about that.  But even more, I am impressed by her helpfulness, her professionalism, and her commitment.  I plan on buying a family plan later today.  I am being a volunteer ambassador for 1Password.  Friends and family are going to hear about it from. I certainly hope that Julia becomes head of marketing sometime soon.  She deserves it as much as 1Password deserves my accolades. Thank you! Greg Smith

text: I've been using 1Password for years, and it keeps getting better and better. Mac support, iOS version, great support, encryption, browser integration...it's everything I could ask for in a password manager.

title: Transitioning from Password 7 to Password 8 with Family membership
text: We, my wife and I, have been using 1Password for a few years and found it very useful.  One drawback is that the licensing terms meant that we had to purchase two copies of the app (up through 1Password 7) to run on our two iMacs, we shared our passwords by synching the password database file through Dropbox.  This year I rather reluctantly decided to go with the subscription model and I bought a Family membership, and I started using the beta version of Password 8.  There were some glitches recently when I transitioned my wife to Password 8 and the shared Family membership (not the fault of 1Password itself).  This is now working quite well, though I am still not completely comfortable with the redesigned user interface.  The app is fast enough so that I am not particularly concerned with the way it is implemented (with some web technology underneath).  The shared and private vault scheme works well for us, with virtually all our password in the Family shared vault.  I wish that Apple would adopt a similar approach for shared Contacts, which are a bit of a pain to achieve using multiple Apple IDs.

title: Marcus was very helpful and got back to‚Ä¶

title: What a headache of an app
text: [My answer to company reply:] I wish the support team answered as quick as the media managing team. If I knew I would had started by publishing my review here first, and then move to the support team. It took 2 days for support to answer my questions. On the third day I finally managed to access my account (eventhough my credit card info was accepted perfectly well from day one) So, in what world getting support 2 days later, for something as critical as a password manager, is a good service? You barely offer ways of resetting or recovering one's account, yet you take for 2 days to provide help?? Common, I'm glad the media managing branch is on top of everything, but I'm not looking for a media managing app. So, please spare me the whole act and focus on improving your support. [Original message] What a headache of an app. Stay away from this piece of crap. It is impossible to get support on the phone or even chat. If you loose your master password, you are in for a world or pain. It is impossible to recover your account if you loose your password or masterkey. Plus, the login is the crapiest ever, it doesn't work with other password managers (at least not my current one) because it has the extra field for the masterkey. Also, it doesn't allow you to see what password you are writing, so good luck finding out which letter you got wrong. It is a terrible service. I cancelled within the trial period, after spending 3 days trying to recover my account since I lost my password. Ugh, worse experience with software in a long time. I wanted to try their family version, since I have a lifetime suscription to another service, but unless your family has multiple IT degrees, don't even bother. Stay away from this piece of crap!!
