title: Amazing customer service - responsive and helpful!
text: After signing up for 1Password, I was initially having trouble getting it to work to save passwords in my browser (Chrome). I emailed Customer Service and they were so incredibly helpful. They got back to me right away to help troubleshoot. It required 2-3 emails back and forth to fix the problem, and each time the customer service representatives were prompt, helpful, and offered solutions that seemed like the "reasonable" next step with an appropriate level of detail for a mostly-computer-literate-but-not-expert like me (not just "try restarting your computer" but also not "go to this obscure website and enter HTML code.") I was very busy at work that week so wasn't sure whether I would have time to troubleshoot before my free trial subscription ended, so I emailed them about that - and they extended my free trial so I could make sure I liked the product and it worked for me. I am now up and running and will definitely be keeping and renewing my subscription, and recommending the product to others! Thanks 1Password for your excellent customer service - I am sure the product is great and the technology is top-notch, but for me it was the responsive helpful customer service that sealed the deal!

title: Had problems getting 1Password to work‚Ä¶

title: I have used 1Password for years
text: I have used 1Password for years. I have trusted it and with good reason. The upgrade from 7 1Password 8 for Safari was problematic, however, and, for me, at least was not as intuitive or as easy as previous versions. I had trouble with getting and keeping the extension when I did get it. Thanks to a great support team and genuine concern to see that the issue was resolved to my satisfaction, there were many exchanges between me and the support team to determine what was happening. While I occasionally lost my cool, they remained professional throughout determined to achieve a resolution and they did. 1Password 8 is a great product (thus far) and very fast; the team's dedication and effort are the reason. With a few tweaks, better instructions, perhaps more graphics for old duffers like me, upgrading will be a breeze.

title: The only Trustpilot review I shall ever write
text: So there I was after eons (it felt like eons) using an Excel Spreadsheet for passwords and secret words and stuff I wanted to keep secret. And even though I love using spreadsheets; it was so cumbersome and unintuitive to use a spreadsheet sitting in the storage of my computer. I wasn‚Äôt able to use my list on my smartphone. Excel Online wasn‚Äôt a thing yet. Come to think of it, smartphones weren‚Äôt reallly that popular then. At least for me. I kept searching and trying out so many different password managers until I found 1Password. I can‚Äôt remember for how long I‚Äôve been using it, but it must be close to all my adult life. Which is ‚Ä¶ a lot of years. I love that it syncs perfectly with my desktop and laptop computers, with my smartphone and with the smartphones of my family. I love the suggestions for passwords, the integration with browsers and the clean user interface. Come to think of it; I love everything about it. I share it with my family, I recommend it to my friends and colleagues. And if there is one subscription service that I will never stop using (and I use a few -> streaming services, you know), it‚Äôs 1Password. It just works. It helps me to be more productive and more secure throughout my day. Every. Single. Day. 1Password is the first app on my smartphone homescreen. It‚Äôs starting automatically when I turn on my computer. And it sits in my browser extensions waiting to be used. And used it will be. When I read the newsletters from the 1Password team I know that it is being made with love. It really shows that. So if you need a password manager; and believe me when I say: ‚ÄòYou absolutely do need a password manager‚Äô. Look no further; don‚Äôt use a free password manager with fewer functions; and don‚Äôt settle for less. Just try 1Password and share it with your family.

I am a journalist and a consultant, and these passwords are critical. Not to mention the financial applications, investments and Banking data.    The customer support is exceptional.  They totally protect (and don't even know,) the master password, because it is entirely encrypted end to end. However they are skillful in guiding you to the correct functions, help pages, and creative graphic illustrating the articles.   I appreciate the ability to have separate vaults and to synch the files between devices.  A Mac M1, an iPad Pro, and my Apple 12 phone.    Fantastic support, great application, and frequent updates with critical upgrades.   I wish all my applications and software had this level of customer consideration.

title: It works; I trust it; Customer Service is of equal quality
text: I believe I‚Äôve used 1Password for close to or over a decade now. For the most part it just works. When it doesn‚Äôt, it‚Äôs almost always been my error. I don‚Äôt recall a 1Password defect ever putting me at risk or interfering with my work. At most there have been UI / UX complaints I might have leveled *and* I‚Äôve seen them steadily refine tools over years. It‚Äôs well supported; the support team is knowledgeable, thorough yet concise, and above all decent & kind to customers. I know, because they‚Äôve never made me feel foolish about a problem that was (99% of the time) my mistake. I even recall a developer once answering my questions about underlying implementation, who answered my question even though I have a layperson‚Äôs expertise in asking or understanding the reply. These kinds of software products & companies are an uncommon breed. I avoid being a fan or a stanning products nowadays, but 1Password is a product I come close to doing that for. If they keep charting a steady course, I can imagine this being a service I use for life.

text: I am not good with computer matters, but the 1Password Team helped me achieve a transfer from my .com account to a .eu account. title: I am quite happy with 1Password
text: I am quite happy with 1Password. I have one complaint, though. I use 1Password to collect my passwords and occasionally to create new ones. I don't often need 1Password to fill in a password. So, the pop-up window that appears whenever there is a form to be filled in is a bit annoying. First you have to login to 1Password and then you can fill in the form but I have often been distracted by the fact that Safari and 1Password compete with each other when there is something to be filled in.  I asked about this problem and thankfully got a simple solution: to disable the 1Password Safari extension. Still I wonder whether it wouldn't be possible to place the pop-up window somewhere else on the screen than next to the field that needs to be filled in. One more thing: I'd like a password generator that is accessible without having to login to 1Password

title: 1Password the best getting better all the time
text: 1Password was the best thing I found to manage my passwords years ago, and it keeps getting better.  I now have a family account and the words "do you remember my password" are a thing of the past... 1Password does!

title: What Makes 1Password The Most Powerful Password Manager So Far
text: 1. Apps Across Different Platforms 1Password introduces apps that are available across many different platforms, including Windows, IOS, Android, Linux, etc., which is one of the major selling points of this password management service. 2. Secure Cloud Storage Unlike some other password management companies, 1Password uses its own cloud services to store the users' data, which is safe and hazard-free. 3. Auto-filling I suppose the auto-filling function is yet another major selling point for 1Password, you will be able to auto-fill not only your logins but also your credit cards, addresses, and basic information such as names and birth dates stored in the personal profile. 4. Reliable CS Team You can reach out to the 1Password team on Twitter, on the support forum, or by email. Whatever the channel is, you will be greeted with professional and friendly agents who will have the problems sorted for you.

title: To humans!  Fine humans!  May they rule just a little while longer!
text: I asked a fairly straight question, I got a bot.  The BitBot did not understand, and left me feeling a little sad.  But I must have demonstrated that I might be able to pass a Turing test, I didn‚Äôt seem hateful, and I spelled everything correctly, so when I asked for a person I was directed to a Nate.  Nate gave me more than I expected on the first pass, and that was super cool. And then I also got to meet Melicia and Saif with similar results.  To humans!  They are generally superior.  I am a proud longtime customer, and I haven‚Äôt even mentioned the product yet.  To be fair, if I were Canadian, I‚Äôd keep the doors locked and screen all the US support requests with a bot, too.  I can‚Äôt blame you, things are pretty tense down here. Sorry about that.  We miss you.

title: Lost MFA, Recovered Well
text: I've been using 1 password for years, love it.  Recently, I had a complicated situation where I got a new phone, erased the old one, and no longer had access to my MFA app.  Support tried hard to recover my account using a series of account related questions.  I couldn't answer them but was glad to see it's very difficult to get around MFA.  Eventually i used the 1pass export vault feature to backup my old account and created a new one.  1pass support transferred my early adopter special plan i had to my new account and gave me a $20 credit.  All communication was fair, fast, and courteous.

title: Great Support

Under her control all the issues were resolved in a timely manner and everything is working very well now. 1Password itself is a great app - been using it for years. I see so many poor, insecure methods people use for managing their passwords. They should all use 1Password as it is so easy, versatile and SECURE.

title: Great product, great support
text: I've been using 1Password for more than a year, and I like it far better than two other similar products I've tried in the past. But recently, I had to use their support channels for a question about a hardware security key that was misbehaving. It turned out to be the key manufacturer's fault for using a non-standard encryption key length, but the 1Password developers proactively provided a solution even before the key manufacturer released a modified firmware image to address the problem from their end. Now the key works fine as-is. Three cheers for 1Password!

title: Timely and helpful support
text: I reached out to 1Password for a refund (because my plan is now covered through a business plan), they were helpful and responsive. But then my bank charged me instead of giving the money back. I reached out to 1Password again for help, they were timely and extremely helpful in getting me the information I needed to resolve the matter. 1Password is a great product and also has great supper!

title: Lightning fast support!
text: Th support is not quick, it‚Äôs just lightning fast! Receiving an answer on an email question in 10 minutes - that‚Äôs fantastic!!!  And all the rest is of the same level - mobile app, desktop app, browser extension. I‚Äôm paying annual and absolutely happy with this investment!

title: Awesome service
text: Awesome service!  I've been using 1Password for a couple of years now and is an important part of my day to day and securing my information. I've now extended it to my family so they can embrace more secure habits also.  Support has been of great help in the process.

title: Great Linux support and great service
text: I am using 1password  on Linux and very happy with it. There is notable effort going into developing a good client and the cli features and browser integration are also only getting better. The one time I had an actual issue with the setup on a new PC due to a bug in their code, the support was very friendly, offered an immediate workaround and the issue was fixed in the very next version. Installing 1Password has made my life notably easier and I really don't want to miss it anymore :)

title: I prefer to speak with someone when‚Ä¶
text: I prefer to speak with someone when there is an issue because I can ask additional questions and get a better understanding of how the app works. I am not clear about how my issue was resolved. It is a cost savings for you however I am still not sure what to expect the next time.

title: Excellent service from the 1password‚Ä¶
text: Excellent service from the 1password support team as always. I would have no reservations about recommending them.

title: A Lifesaver
text: I dragged my feet over switching over to a password manager. Now that it's done, I can say it was worth the time and investment. I don't have experience with other password managers, but my experience with 1Password has been very good. Recently I needed help in recovering my password. I was grateful that I could interact with a real person who listened and responded. They even followed up to make sure that my issue was resolved. Very professional.

title: A must have application
text: Outstanding app, extraordinarily good support and a fair subscription price make this application a "must have". The elimination of local vaults and the lack of the option to process payments via PayPal do not appeal to me. Still, I think the app is unrivaled

text: 1Password extension is unusable because of the loading times. Sometimes it doesn't load at all. This leaves me unable to log in anywhere because I thought keeping my credentials in 1Password would be a good idea.

title: The team is very responsive and‚Ä¶
text: The team is very responsive and helpful, guild me step by step for the actions needed. Truly appreciate their patience and professional response on my inquiry.

title: The responses were very helpful
text: Date of experience:   May 11, 2022

title: I had selected a wrong plan method
text: I had selected a wrong plan method, contacted support via email and within minutes, my issue was quickly resolved.

title: Great support team
text: Needed help changing my Master Password and I sent a message asking how to go about it.  Received a detailed email walking me through the process.  Timothy took the extra step of telling me what I would need to do to change the password on my phone app as well.  Very pleased with the support and the product overall too!

title: I had a couple of challenges. Support resolved them!
text: I had a couple of challenges using some aspects of the newly installed 1 Password and turned to support for help. The interface is somewhat different from the LastPass that I have been using for years and I wasn't used to the new software. Timothy and the rest of the support team were patient and supplied thorough instructions to resolve my concerns and I am now enjoying this software. They exemplify exceptional support and concern for their customers and that's very unusual and is an exception rather than the rule. Excellent and highly reviewed software combined with top notch support is the recipe for their success. No regrets for switching from LastPass.

title: Impressive support team expertise
text: I am impressed by and extremely grateful for the 1Password support team. When I downloaded the 1Password app on my Android phone and tried to enable the biometric unlock, I received an error message. I tried many times, tried uninstalling and reinstalling the app, tried resaving my fingerprint, but could not get it to work. When I contacted their support team, they gave me instructions on how to fix the error and it worked! Here's the amazing thing. I had been experiencing the same problem with being unable to enable fingerprint unlock with another password manager app for at least a year and that app's support team was never able to figure out how to fix it. The instructions I received from the 1Password support team fixed the problem for both apps! This is impressive and I am again grateful that they have the expertise to help even with errors that are not caused by their own app itself.

title: very reactive
text: It's was a very reactive

title: An outstanding customer support service you can find in the world
text: A good service or a good app goes hand in hand with excellent customer support.  And that's what you can find at 1Password's customer support team.  This is one of the best customer support services I've had.  In the past when using apps or services, I rarely contacted the support team because they were not very friendly or were not good enough with my problems.  But when using 1Password and getting support from the customer support team, I was completely satisfied with what they brought.  Any question, any question no matter how big or small, simple or complex that you encounter in the process of using 1Password will be answered in detail and completely.  They respond to your emails on a daily basis, so it's not long after you submit your question that you'll get the answers you want in your inbox.  The email replies are also very cute and witty.  I think I will ask them about the food I should eat tomorrow.  It is because of the enthusiasm and thoughtfulness of the customer support team that has contributed a lot to me sticking with 1Password for more than two years now and many more years to come.  Thank you for your dedication and hard work towards customers like me.

title: I had a major problem with 1Password‚Ä¶
text: I had a major problem with 1Password after upgrading to 8.7. Failing to begin to understand what the problem was I contacted support. Through a series of emails that went to about 11pm EST, the problem was resolved‚Äîeach reply with a request to follow up straightaway if something didn‚Äôt quite work. After a couple (?) of emails, I had sufficient information to sort things out‚Äîwith the ability to check my process through with 1Password support after each step an often get another little hint for the next stage of recovery. Incredibly impressed!!!! No BS at all‚Äîif someone wasn‚Äôt quite sure, they easily passed it up to the next level.

title: Service was fast + helpful..
text: Service was fast + helpful... Got my problem solved quickly.

title: A good and effective password manager‚Ä¶
text: A good and effective password manager that is easy to work with. Also the app for mobile devices works great. They also have with a very good  and helpful support team backing it.

title: Would definitely recommend 1Password
text: Gave the free trial a shot having used Dashlane for some time. Initial set up went well but a promotional offer I came across wouldn't work and I'd also set us a US account instead of eu. I asked the support line for help with this and they talked me through changing to the eu server and then applied the promo offer. So I'm very happy with the customer support and the product.

title: Great Product Great Support Great Podcast
text: I have been using 1Password for a number of years. I am not a tech head and stress about anything new to do with passwords. 1Password has made setting up new logins, using logins, saving key info and keeping a little in the loop with internet security (Random but Memorable podcast) easier with few laughs tossed in.  Recently I had to make what I saw as a scary move across to the web based version so all my devices synched automatically.  Mark and his team were patient, respectful and so so helpful in sorting me across.  In the end I‚Äôm not sure why I was worried.  Highly recommended product with fabulous support and love the podcast.

title: Great Platform, Even Better Customer Service
text: I've been using 1Password for years, and have loved it. Best ever. Recently we signed up for the family version so that we could share certain passwords amongst ourselves and, should anything untoward happen to me, there would be access for all of my family. In other words, things would not grind to a halt.  What I have learned since switching over is just how good 1Password's customer service is. Their follow-up, professionalism and friendliness just reinforced to me how/why this is the best password manager platform there is, bar none.

title: 1Password has excellent customer service -- with a real person not a BOT!
text: I decided to try 1Password after trying for weeks to get support from Dashlane.  I found I was mostly talking to a "Bot" and the help I received was just pages of info to wade through to try and figure out the issues myself.  This is not what I consider customer service.     1Password was listed on "Think Geek" where I get a lot of my tech info from.  I read up on the program, and decided to try it.  I downloaded it, followed the easy and concise instructions and had it up and running in about 15 minutes.  The "Emergency Kit" is great, it has the secret key on it and a box for me to put my master password which the system created.   I had a few issues with signing in and synching the program with my browser.  I sent an email to customer support, and received a reply very quickly from "Alex" who asked me a few questions.  I told him what was happening and he  sent me details on how to go into the program and change a few settings, along with screen shots that showed me exactly what to look for.  He checked back with me to see if everything was working fine, and I appreciated his excellent customer service.  I know that if I do run into something, all I have to do is send an email to customer support and I will get that, quickly and easily and without a BOT sending me pages of info to sort through.  This was quick, easy and friendly customer service.

title: My wife's 1P developed a problem
text: My wife's 1P developed a problem: she could not log in using the icon in her Finder's taskbar (OS X).  I tried various fixes but they did not work.  I found the contact link on the 1P site, and Josephine responded.  She recommended a solution (erase the 1P data on my wife's Mac, then restore it using my master account).  This worked, and we waited several days to make sure the problem had gone away.  Another agent emailed to see if things were OK, and I said yes.   Agents were friendly and Josephine knew the right answer the first time.  Response time (~1 day) satisfactory, though if this had been my computer issue I would have wanted faster reaction.

text: Alex S was extremely helpful and patient to guide me on how to merge the data from my old 1Password account to the new one.  1Password is now working smoothly on all of my devices.  Thank you, Alex!

title: Happy "old-form" license holder finally moves into the future, and LOVES IT.
text: I‚Äôm sure you have all heard a great deal of criticism on the subscription move. I definitely qualify as one of those frustrated ‚Äúhangers on‚Äù to my old-form licenses.  However, within minutes of establishing my online account I was gaining new value with 1Password. I think the biggest surprise for me was the ‚Äúa ha‚Äù that the browser extensions now worked *anywhere* without needing the client installed and syncing set up. This opened 1password features to my work devices and other places it could never be before. Now I‚Äôm experimenting with new ways of working as I learn about all the features I‚Äôve been missing out on for years.  Finally, bravo to your engineering and design teams. Across multiple devices and modes every setup ‚Äújust works‚Äù. I went through the vault migration process myself late at night and became confident I could get my wife set up in minutes. And I did. Use is effortles - "intersection of security and ease" indeed! But as a technologist I appreciate this takes a tremendous effort by a lot of people to create. It has literally melted my frustration on subscription away and I found myself demonstrating 1p features to a colleague who was mentioning the excel based approach she uses with her team üò¨ For any others still grousing about the subscription model - I have witnessed the value, convenience, and ease that comes along with it, and I'm happy to continue my many years as a 1Password user. I think you should take the plunge as well. In his last update Dave offered a discount for existing users and with an email to support I was able to take advantage of that same offer for my family. Please pass along my gratitude to the team for their hard work. And Dave too.

title: I thought I was charged twice for my‚Ä¶
text: I thought I was charged twice for my account. I sent a message to 1Password and got immediate response and by the next day I knew what happened. I checked my billing with 1Password and realized it was a mistake on my error due to setting up renewal payment. Sorry guys and awesome job on emails and responding.

title: Helpful and responsive!
text: Helpful and responsive! My previous boss deleted our team account without checking with me first as they didn't realize I still had my account with 1Password. When I panicked and thought I had lost almost a decade's worth of passwords, the 1Password support team guided me through the steps to get my data back. They were cool and calm and helped put my mind at ease during a very stressful situation. I would absolutely recommend this product and their support!  The only thing that's a bit of a bummer is that initially when we wrote in to ask for the data to be recovered my boss and I were both told that once an account has been deleted the data is gone forever. It was only once I shared that some very critical personal financial information was stored in my account and that if lost could not be recovered did they walk us through the process of recovering an account. I can't understand why we were told it was gone forever initially and then once they realized the gravity of the situation helped us recover the account. If it's recoverable, that should be shared from the beginning. It created a great deal of stress for me intially.  All is well that ends well though and I'm glad to have my data back and will continue to be a customer!

Update:  hi Blake. Unfortunately you are not correct. Specifically I used 1Password for Safari on my phone and iPad and now it states that to use it, I need a 1Password account. So this is specific functionality that has been removed to force me to go to the subscription model. I will just use apple‚Äôs own password manager - I don‚Äôt need a subscription for that. I have been a 1Password user since at least version 3, but version 7 will be the last one I use.

title: Agilebits abandoned its long-time‚Ä¶
text: Agilebits abandoned its long-time customers by switching to a subscription/cloud model and forcing customers to comply or else lose support on major browser updates. Customers who do not want a company holding and managing their secrets must choose a different tool. Edit for clarification:  Per AgileBits support: "The newly released 1Password 8 apps only work with 1Password accounts, and don't support older standalone vaults synced with third party services, such as Dropbox." The original 1Password model allowed customers to store their secrets locally or with a 3rd party like DropBox. The new subscription model forces customers to store their secrets with AgileBits, the company that runs 1Password.  This new model means that customers must trust one company to both write the encryption software and to physically hold the secrets. Consequently, a bad actor within AgileBits could compromise the encryption in their customer's software and ALSO have access to the secrets. Previously, while a bad actor could have compromised the encryption, they would have no access to the actual secrets (provided you control network access, of course). Aside from the subscription requiring regular payments, which is perfectly acceptable and worth it, they allow no option for customers to store their secrets anywhere besides within AgileBits' systems. Customers can continue to use the older 1Password 6, but AgileBits ended support for it so they will not update it to support new browser certificates. Customers have lost and will continue to lose the ability to use 1Password's various browser integrations.

Creating and changing passwords can be a bit more complex, as I have passwords in multiple browsers, in various applications, all requiring a different way of creating and changing passwords. So far, I‚Äôm happy with the ability to create strong passwords in 1Password, with options for ‚Äúmemorable‚Äù words or long strings of different numbers, characters and symbols.

title: Excellent customer service
text: I've recently decided to try the subscription model of 1Password again, having been a User of their stand-alone software for some years on my iMac. I found an offer online, then after subscribing, found a much better offer, which allowed me to include my Wife's PC in a Family subscription. This left me with a little work to do regarding which email related to which offer. I also had problems trying to remove a previously 'frozen' account [vault], when I tried (but then rejected) the subscription model, 3 years ago. The final problem concerned the actual cost of the new subscription detailed in their reminders about the trial period ending etc. and the exact cost - which didn't appear to be a 3-year deal with 50% off (as a long standing User). So I mailed 1Password for help in sorting this out. Well, I have to say that I had excellent customer service from all the 1Password support staff and within about 3 cycles of emails, I had the answers that I needed, including a simple email link which allowed me to delete the old 'frozen' password vault. This made life so much easier, as I had by then finished tidying up my existing set of passwords (many of which were redundant when reviewed). I don't think I've had such good customer support since my last minor gripe with Amazon - who frankly lead the way IMHO when resolving any support related issues. So due to the excellent help I had from Ixquel, Paul, Anthony and lastly, Alex I am now about to become a fully paid up User of 1Password. Very well done guys! PS one little tip I learned from them - do try to get all your questions asked in one email (if possible), as by adding bits of extra information in further emails actually puts you further back in their email queue; apparently they answer them in a received-order basis. I found that a little odd, but on second thoughts, I guess it is logical (and means they don't leave old emails behind unanswered). Best regards Terry :)

So now I have to take a subscription. But the worst part is, that if I try to take a subscription, 1Password locks and has to be stopped forced. And the pop-up, yes, keeps on popping up! terrible!

title: I've used 1Password for several years‚Ä¶
text: I've used 1Password for several years now and couldn't be happier. It's easy to use and I feel confident in the security of the difficult-to-crack passwords.

title: By my own doing
text: By my own doing, I lost my vault.  177 items!  Gone!  Had to delete my account and try to start over. I was in tears!  But your support team never gave up.  Over a weeks time, we tried this, that and everything; constant communication.  They followed each other‚Äôs threads as they changed shifts and would recommend something else.  Finally a Lifeguard of mercy found the magic answer and returned my missing 177 items!  I cannot say enough about your team and their obvious passion for what they do.  You have incredible people working there.  Don‚Äôt change a thing!  You‚Äôre all amazing!!

title: Excellent customer support
text: Excellent customer support.  I had a problem with installing 1Password on a new device using an existing account.  Less than half a day after sending 1Password an email, I got a prompt response that resolved my problem (which by the way was my lack of understanding).  Thanks, 1Password.  Your Customer Support is terrific!

title: Reliable & prompt service
text: I had some difficulties with my subscription after creating a new account but their support team had been really helpful all throughout and never left me in the dark. They obviously take care of their subscribers. Thank you for being reliable & prompt in your service. Seth has been amazing the whole stretch. Thank you!

title: Great software, even better support
text: I am a 1Password-user for years. Now I changed from the one-time purchase to the family account. Some problems with my configuration occurred what was the reason for writing to the support. They helped me within hours with multiple problems very kind, very polite and always with a good solution. Thank you very much for great software and even better support.

title: Well done!
text: I messaged support (which I found easily) with a request I thought it would take weeks to resolve if at all. Within minutes I had a response and clear instructions. Minutes after that, another agent processed a credit and a transfer of my billing. Exceptional customer service experience all around. Thanks!

title: Good support when I needed it
text: I have used 1Password since 2016, so I know the software inside and out. This is the first time I've needed to contact support--which in itself is a statement about how solid this software is. And the reason I had to contact them this time was my own mistake. The customer support was very strong. They have detailed response templates and were able to help me solve my problem.  Two minor weaknesses: 1. The first support reply took longer than I expected; I think more than a day, and a few other back and forths took over night. This was reasonable, but sometimes felt long. 2. One of the replies was a stock template that didn't address my direct question. When I pointed it out, I got a quick reply apologizing and answering. Overall, I felt like I was in very good hands and getting the right answers. My issue was solved and I was provided lots of good information along the way. Update after receiving company response to my review (below):  The reply from the company is consistent with my support experience‚Äîtemplates stick response that is very good but doesn‚Äôt show understanding or careful read. Stick replies are efficient and good for lots of things, but would feel better with a little bit of personalization to the issues raised.

title: great and fast service!

title: I wanted to upgrade to a family plan
text: I wanted to upgrade to a family plan, to get my mother-in-law up and running... she's not the most tech savvy person and I wanted to assist her when she needed help with online accounts, as well as to make sure her data was safe. 1password was the right answer. I hoped I could perhaps get a bit of a discount on the upgrade, as I've been a 1pass user for 10 years now. I'd seen a new user discount of 50% off on three years, but since I was an existing user the support staff suggested a free year instead. That was the incentive I was looking for, plus a rebate on the remainder of my current account. Through the links sent by support I was able to get my mother in law up and running (via TeamViewer) very quickly.

title: I have been a 1Password user since‚Ä¶
text: I have been a 1Password user since 2011. For openers, be warned that it is confusing when you first get started with it.  If it were not, would the Take Control Books publishers offer a $15 PDF book covering 1Password? (BTW, if you are buying 1P for the first time, save yourself a lot of headaches and buy the book) If you are patient and willing to devote the time, you will find that it is well worth it because, on Apple devices, it works flawlessly when installed on your iPad, iPhone, and Mac computer.   Read any of the serious review sites, i.e., those who are not being paid to shill for a product, and you'll always see 1P in the top three password manager choices and often it will be at the very top. Support is quite good; they have an active support forum and your questions get answered reasonably quickly; often, but not always, the day you post them. Folks who man the forum are happy to get involved in a back-and-forth, continuing dialog with you until your problems get sorted out. You won't regret signing up with 1Password.

Since I was an early adopter of the software I was offered 50% off the annual subscription rate for the next three years which I thought was fairly priced. I‚Äôm delighted with how smoothly and easily the new software runs. All the accompanying information regarding the emergency kit and set up of new software was easy to understand. 1Password is better than ever and I‚Äôm very happy with it!

text: I had just clean installed my OS and noticed that my 1Password software had modified the way it had previously behaved when clicking and dragging the password field over to the blank password field in my browser or apps. A smile spread over my face on this, so I inquired with support, thinking they would likely escalate my issue.Instead of doing so, they inquired about my workflow, asked about some specifics, and really dug in with me, in order to get me an accurate response to what was happening. They got back to me within a couple of hours with the information I requested, and not only that, they communicated in such a way that let me know I was definitely dealing with someone who cared and valued my inquiry as much as my patronage. This team is passionate about the user experience, and if I ever should need support again, I will not hesitate to connect with this team over at AgileBits!

title: Had an issue with my 1Password account
text: I have generally been pretty happy with 1Password, works very well and nice to only have to worry about one Master Password, as well as working well with iPhone and Face ID. But I did recently have an issue where I was suddenly getting email notifications literally in the middle of the night that someone was signing into my 1Password account from a location several hundred miles away from me. This had never happened previously in the past several years I have been using 1Password, so I assumed the worst and cancelled my 1Password account, changed nearly all of my passwords (using Safari, which took a few hours), and eventually started a new 1Password account- which I have to admit I don't quite feel comfortable with at the moment. Emails to 1Password support informed me that: "because of the nature of Apple's Privacy features, there is no saying when you can receive these notifications. It is random when Apple will change the IP address that is assigned to your device. 1Password sees this change in IP and believes that you are signing in from a new device, while we have made some changes on our side, we still do not have total control over these messages as we still need to keep things secure when new devices actually sign in. These notifications can even come when you are not using your device, if the device has an internet connection, you can get one of these notifications." Some warning that this could occur would have been very helpful, especially as this is a new issue. To their credit, 1Password Support did clearly explain the situation (though after the fact), and did facilitate transferring my account over to the new one. After contacting Customer Support, it did take about 24 hours to get a response.

title: Why I am giving the 5 stars to the 1Password Customer Support group..
text: If there were 10 stars, I would give all of them to the Customer Support group (Trevor, Alex, Pierre, Yasmine, Melania, and others). An extraordinary group of people, knowledgeable but more importantly friendly. They make it easier to customers to start working on a simple by content, but rich functionality hybrid of the two different software techniques: the browser extension and an web based app. 1Password.is a product that demands extensive training. of the candidates for the Customer Support group. Kudos all all them.

text: I have been using 1Password for a number of years now and I am overall very pleased with the product. In connection with the software moving from a one-time purchase to a subscription model (and you basically HAVE to accept this, otherwise you are no longer getting new versions of the app), I had some technical challenges and was wondering about a promotional offer for new subscribers. Without going too much into detail, I just wanted to say that the support I received was both fast, to the point, courteous, helpful and quite accommodating. text: We were using the Google extension in 1 Password and even after recovery, the account wouldn't login.   This was a situation where there were different Google Profiles.  The 1Password team stepped in and confirmed that the account could logged in to with the new Secret Key and Password at https://my.1password.com/ Unfortunately that didn't work because the account didn't appear to be there. 1Password again stepped up and solved the problem with the aid of some customer screenshots.  The instructions were, "You should be able to sign in to the account by clicking the blue link that says 'Sign in to another account' at the bottom of that page." That solved the problem! 1Password's support team is amazing. It is awesome how they continually interact with the customer during the whole troubleshooting process and are so friendly, knowledgeable, professional and encouraging!

title: 1Password user for roughly a decade1Password "new" extension challenges
text: 1Password user for roughly a decade. Hands down one of the most used and most crucial apps in my daily computing. While the application has continued to exceed my expectations for years, the browser extension's recent overhaul has been a challenge to use. Where I'm fortunately able to find the "old" 1Password extension by ID, simply searching only brings up the "new" version or the "beta" version. With a recent configuration issue I attempted to use the new extension that does not require an app to be installed on my Mac, but this forces different keyboard shortcuts and alters the workflow heavily on mouse usage. Where it certainly looks more polished, it makes usage more difficult and popups regularly occur on webpages where they should not be. Sadly, since all websites are coded differently, 1Password engineers can only handle so many edge cases. I do hope they will continue to support the extension that relies on a native app being installed, the workflow and experience was/is significantly better. If they ever remove the old extension, I likely will find an alternative for my family subscription.

title: One-time license vs. subscription license model
text: I'm a very long time 1Password user. My first version was version 3, and I'm very happy with the product. Some time ago, 1Password has switched from the one-time license model to the subscription license model (like many/most software providers).  Both models have pros and cons, and initially I was a bit disappointed to have to pay every year. But on the other side, I get regularly updated software - something very important in this area. And, also with the one-time license, I had to buy or upgrade to a new license every couple years. So the difference is not that big.  Furthermore, after discussing the switch from one-time to subscription and the higher costs with the 1Password support team, they offered me a nice reduction on the subscription. All in all fair and generous. Thanks and keep up the good work.

title: 1Password is awesome.
text: 1Password is awesome. My family and I have been customers since 2017, when I subscribed to a family plan. More recently, I joined a company that uses 1Password and it has been great to manage my personal and business information using a single platform. I sincerely recommend it - I actually have done this many times over these years. Up to about one year ago, I'd give 1Password 5 stars without blinking. There are two reasons I went for 4 stars: 1. I had issues the last two times the program suggested an update on Mac. On both occasions the update failed right after uninstalling the program, which forced me to reinstall it manually. 2. Since mid last year I've been using 1Password on a few Linux machines and I really miss the simplicity of unlocking it with the fingerprint reader. The problem here is that, unlike other programs, 1Password doesn't support creating a separate PAM configuration and I cannot enable that option for the entire system. The positive outcome of these two issues is that I ended up interacting with the company's support. I was definitely impressed by how friendly and attentive they are.

title: Really Tripped Before the Finish Line
text: I have used numerous password managers in my time both personally and in IT.  LastPass has been everything horrible about it, Safari and Chrome are too locked down, and 1Password, though it is the best, most user-friendly GUI out of all of them, still stumbles to take the crown. Why? Because it fails to address customer needs when they stand in the way of profit margins.  Children, gather round - for I have a story to tell. Once upon a time there was a thing called perpetual licensed software.  If you're young enough, you probably don't know what that is.  Essentially, you bought a product, and its license of use was owned by you, the consumer. Nowadays, the subscription model has grown to be the ultimate cash stream.  Companies can hide behind excuses like: "security will continuously be updated", "GUI improvements will keep coming", and "just trust us; this is better." But the problem is that (especially companies that started off with selling software that had perpetual licenses) it feels like a true bait and switch.  This is especially true when you take away key components that bring your customers back. For 1Password (version 7, most notably), you used to be able to create/store/maintain your own encrypted vault through DropBox (or other means).  When they took this vital feature away [in version 8], it created a great divide - to use their newer software ever again, you would have to use their vault storage that (surprise!) required a monthly/annual subscription. I get that the model for subscription is more attractive and DOES have some good points, but when you ostracize the key group that helped you reach the top of the game, it feels wrong, disingenuous, slimy, and straight up manipulative.  Perpetual licensing for 1Password 8 or 9 or above would make things so much better. Should they reintroduce the feature, I will be back but I think their increased revenue stream might be too attractive to pass up.

text: My subscription is about to renew at the beginning of the next month and I am happy to say that this thing is very reliable. It's a very easy interface to create a new login and random password on the fly for whatever you need. I was never too keen on writing down all my passwords, so this app is the most perfect thing I could've asked for. It has touch-ID, categorization of passwords by letter. It definitely took an hour or longer to change all of the passwords I had and import all my data into the app, but it felt great doing it. I'd had my emails compromised before, as well as bank accounts, so having all of my passwords in one place made me feel really secure.

text: I am not Putin. I am not a politician. I'm not military. I am against war. I do not support Putin and what he has been doing with my country for over 10 years. I am against war. But I was born and live in Russia. I have been using your services for over 10 years. I paid you money regularly and at one point you decided to leave me without updating your software, since you deleted your application from the App Store (Russia). I have an active and paid subscription for 1 year, it is valid. How do I get your iPhone and Mac software updates now? It is clear that now it is temporarily not possible to pay for your services with Russian cards, but what about the updates? What's the approach? How can I use your program now? Update it? How can you be trusted now? You just took and threw all the users from Russia. I never thought that American (Canadian too) or European companies could do this. Just take and spit and wipe your feet about customers from Russia. I am an ordinary civilian. It's called Russophobia, what have you done. There have been many hostilities in the world over the past 10 years - Iraq, Syria, Yemen, Libya, Afghanistan. The armies of the United States, Said Arabia and European countries (in Afghanistan) took part in the hostilities. Tens of thousands of civilians were killed. Why didn't you block the Americans, the Europeans or the Saudis? Be consistent now. Or is it different, and the US Army and its allies can fight anywhere? Israel has occupied Palestine, why don't you block users from Israel? This is all hypocrisy on your part.

title: I can highly recommend 1Password
text: I had been using another Password manager program for several years now. In addition to it's relatively high annual cost, it had a few operational and customer service issues that drove me to research other managers. 1Password was the one I chose, The learning curve for 1Password is admittedly a little steep (for me). But I found that the Customer service the company offers via email to be outstanding! It is very rare that I don't receive a reply within 18-24 hours.  Operationally, the program is very easy to use, and I have experienced very few login issues- mostly due to wrong URLs that I entered into the program. In those cases, it is very easy to edit the program entry. 1Password also works well in Android.  1Password has Sharing capability among family members which makes it easy to share All or Selected items- that is a decision for the designated Family Organizer to make. In my experience,1Password is a great program to manage logins, credit card info, and any other items that require secure storage.

text: I‚Äôve been using 1Password for years now and have had convenient peace of mind ever since. text: 1Password is a company that focuses on long term relationship with their customers vs. the short term gains. title: The team is just excellent
text: The team is just excellent. I had changed my master password and locked me out that way. After contactating support they helped me with restoring access. And they gave me a credit for the new account.

title: Good support
text: Honestly, I'm not really convinced of the usability of 1Password. But the support is excellent. They helped me through my troubles and reacted quickly and in a very friendly manner.

title: I've used 1Password for 8 years without‚Ä¶
text: I've used 1Password for 8 years without a hitch. It has saved me countless hours and my sanity. I trust completely and it and feel better having hundreds of stronger randomized passwords locked inside it, and have converted many people over to using it! It's also one of the few apps that I'm excited to read the release notes of every update (which is frequent!) Compatibility-wise, I've extremely impressed at how many platforms and browsers 1P works with and how consistent it appears across them all. Speaking of visuals, it's one of the most beautiful Windows apps around, and a joy to use and look at. Sometimes there's issues syncing user-uploaded icons across platforms, but I attribute those to version 8 (new) growing pains and it's not a big deal. The ability to collaborate with other users securely with shared vaults is also very handy - I can split my own passwords into vaults based on shared interest groups like friends/family/husband and share certain vaults with specific groups of people. And now that my workplace adopted the enterprise version of 1P, I can import that vault and have every password I could possibly need all in one application. I've used 1P for 8 years and have had almost zero issues and nothing but admiration for the obvious amount of care put into it. Thank you for making my life easier!

title: 1Password rated #1 in Switzerland

title: A shout out for the 1password support‚Ä¶
text: A shout out for the 1password support team and one password in general. After about nine years using 1pass I decided to go to a account due to the fact I'm getting older and my daughter can easily gain access to all my  vital information. Well with nine years of data and using 1pass4 problems came up! I downloaded 1pass eight and it went south. The team worked with me to uninstall 1pass8, gave me a link to download 1pass7, convert my data, install 1pass8, upgrade from Seven to eight and merge on to my account. all that was left to do was Scan the QR code with my phone and a windows computer a apple computer and my phone was good to go. My wife and I had everything in 1Password and when she passed all I had to do was go to her app and I had all the information I needed, Bank accounts, social security, drivers license, secure notes about her final wishes all in one place. The support team never gave up and always got back to me next day to tackle the next step of the problem and get it up and working. Customer service is what makes a good product great! Thank you John

It may be a bit challenging for non-techies to immediately get the hang of 1Password, but with a little effort and diligence in viewing the 1Password online videos and reaching out for help from their support unit on specific issues, you soon will get the hang of it and simplify and make more secure your online life.

title: The absolute worst UX ever
text: The absolute worst UX ever. Every day or so, my OnePassword extension stops automatically offering to populate password fields. So once per day, I have to click on the browser extension, dig up my Secret Key, and type it into 1Password, select the password I want to copy, refresh the page I'm trying to log in to, and paste it from 1Password.  That, and, every single time you use the extension, you have to put in an even longer password to access 1Password than you ever could have dreamt of for the website you're trying to access.  I understand the value of the latter point from a security standpoint, but why am I forced to input my secret key every morning? It's not like I keep it in a document on my computer where I can just copy and paste it in (because then it's not a secret key, is it? It's on the same system that is vulnerable to an attack from a predator the likes of which 1Password is meant to stop) so I have to manually type it in. Takes like 3 minutes to sign into bank accounts sometimes. Wild.

title: 1Password was once great, but no more. Stay far away.
text: What was once hands down the best password manager in the business has instead become a complete a nightmare. In the past year AgileBits (the creators of 1Password) has shifted development from a wonderful native app to an atrocious Electron app, eliminated standalone licenses, and most egregiously eliminated the ability to have a local non-cloud based vault. Now, in order to use 1Password you must pay a monthly subscription and store all of your most important items, your passwords, in the 1Password cloud! Furthermore, AgileBits has been accepting a ton of VC money, which does not bode well for future decisions as all of the above controversial changes occurred shortly after the first round of an influx of VC money. *EDITED POST REPLY* While I appreciate the reply, no amount of reassurance will make the move to Electron a positive thing. I completely understand that the backend of 1Password has been rewritten in Rust, which is a great thing, but Electron is still Electron no matter how well it is implemented. As important as a safe, secure and efficient backend is, the GUI is just as important, if not more so. The bottom line is Electron will NEVER have a GUI as good or as fluid as a native app. I have been beta testing the Mac version of 1Password 8 since it was first released, and resource usage (as a result of Electron) has consistently doubled, if not triple, the amount of resources that 1Password 7 uses. In addition, since Electron is nothing more than a wrapper for the Chromium browser engine, the interface itself is decidedly non-native. Specifically, while it looks perfectly fine on Big Sur and above, it looks completely and horribly out of place on Catalina. If Apple chooses to change up their interface in the future (which the most definitely will), 1Password will immediately look out of place. I just wish someone from AgileBits would straight up admit that the only reason 1Password was moved to Electron was for cost-cutting reasons and that's it. It certainly wasn't for usability reasons. Speaking of cost-cutting, there is a sick irony to the fact that AgileBits has accepted a ton of VC money, and the first thing they do is cut costs by moving from a great native app to a subpar Electron app. Instead of putting the 10's of millions of dollars toward creating a world-class native app experience (on ALL platforms), AgileBits has taken the money and used it to for marketing and double speak. And I noticed a complete lack of reply when it comes to the elimination of standalone licenses and forcing users to store all of their passwords in the 1P cloud. From a business standpoint, this makes sense, as it justifies users having to pay a perpetual subscription to use 1Password. From a user standpoint, however, it is not only hostile, but straight up insulting. I DON'T want to store my passwords in the 1P cloud, let alone any cloud; forcing your users to do so is reprehensible. Fortunately, there are a ton of options now when it comes to storing your passwords in a secure, safe and user friendly way. As a result of this, I think AgileBits is going to greatly, greatly regret the horrible decisions they have made over the past year or so.

title: Excellent 1Password Tech Support Experience
text: I had purchased 1Password for my iPhone, but had an illness and never got around to doing anything more than establishing my account and loading the software on my phone. When the annual renewal hit my App Store account, I decided it was time to dust off the software and start using what I was paying for.  BUT - I could not for the life of me remember my master password, and I had not every saved my original recovery kit.  Entirely my fault.  But, still, I figured contacting 1Password tech support would be at least worth a try. Imagine my surprise when my initial tentative question to their Tech Support inbox was responded to within an hour, with a genuinely polite, pleasant, and above all, USEFUL set of instructions on how to address my problem.  YES, I had to destroy my original account (and, if I *had* populated the account with passwords, they would have been lost - but again, not the fault of the software, but my own absent-mindedness).  But within a grand total of a couple hours worth of email exchanges, I was all set up and running. My professional role is that of a developer in the customer service/service management space, so I know good service when I experience it.  I can't say enough about the quality service and assistance I received from the team at 1Password.  Thanks again for all your help!

text: Finally switched to a professional (and affordable) password manager after many years of using passwords by heart. SHOULD HAVE DONE THAT MANY YEARS AGO! title: Laura is great and was very helpful‚Ä¶
text: Laura is great and was very helpful guiding me through the process involved with porting my data to the cloud. I had a terrible experience the first time I tried this process on a new computer, where my data was ported to the cloud, vaults emptied and was subsequently locked out from 1password without being able to log back in. We're talking data that I had accumulated since I was a 1Password v3 owner. Needless to say, I didn't have a good time that day. Laura walked me through finding my backups and porting my vaults upstream and all is right with the world again. Please make sure to give her a bump in pay when the time comes because she damn well deserves it! Thanks!

title: A couple of weeks ago  I encountered an‚Ä¶
text: A couple of weeks ago  I encountered an issue with regards to my secret key. They are registered, but you can only retrieve them by accessing your personal emergency kit (which you should store in a safe place) or by manually typing  the information requested. Long-story short, I had had to contact the team (extremely supportive people) to guide me on how to access the credential details and other relevant information. title: 1password Customer Service
text: Since my last review I have heard from the customer support team at 1Password. They were very helpful, although at the end of the day were not able to resolve my issue and as such I requested a full refund - which I have since received. So, 9 out of 10 for customer service ...but I still would have preferred to have a product/service I could have used in a straight forward fashion in the first place. ---------------------------------------------- Unfortunately I fall into the small percentage of people who have had a bad experience with 1password.   I had been using 1password on trial for a while, I had put all of my details on the system and then out of the blue my password to get onto 1password doesn't work.  The process of resetting does work, the secret key to reset the password to get onto 1password doesn't work and the helpdesk is a robot who cannot help ... so sadly I am now left paying for a service i cannot use and have no means of accessing all of the accounts I had set up on 1password (and subsequently destroyed from elsewhere.   From personal experience I cannot recommend 1password

title: I needed to migrate to a new MacBook
text: I needed to migrate to a new MacBook.  I have been a long time user of 1Password and just wanted to make sure the migration did not have any glitches so I asked their support team for some instructions. I have been very diligent in recording user account passwords and license codes for the software I have purchased into 1Password.  I knew that 1Password would greatly simplify my migration tasks since I planned to install all of my software manually and not use the OSX migration tool. The 1Password response was quick and gave some very specific instruction to solve my problem.  The instructions worked and the 1Password install and migration of password data was nearly effortless and totally flawless. Since I had all of my passwords and license codes I could download the latest software, some of which was different due to the jump to Monterey, and easily get it running. The software design team really understands how things should work and the support team makes you feel like you are their most important customer. The integration with the Touch ID key is the "icing on the cake" and launching 1Password opens with a single touch of that key. If you have more than a few password and a few installed programs with licenses you need 1Password.

title: I have been using 1password for about 8‚Ä¶
text: I have been using 1password for about 8 years using the older method of synching passwords between Windows, Android and iOS using Dropbox, for most of that time and it worked well. However this system is not supported by 1password any longer and I needed to change to the new cloud based system. The new system does have a cost but after doing some comparisons the 1password pricing is reasonable.   The new system links everything a central server. I set up all my devices again and they all work well. The 1password team was very helpful in helping with the transition to the new system. So far I have had no problems accessing my passwords on any of the platforms, Windows, Android, IOS. Many thanks

title: Reliable, feature-rich, and nicely designed password manager.
text: I have been using 1Password for a few years and it has worked excellently and without problems on any of the platforms I use. These are Windows, macOS, Android, and iOS. 1Password is additionally the password manager I have experienced, is best integrated on most platforms in terms of design and features. The design of the 1Password apps is far ahead of any of their competitors in my opinion. 1Password does as it promises: Quick insertion of logins when logging in while generating secure passwords and saving these. It is a super idea that 1Password a few months ago began a collaboration with Fastmail to create masked emails easily and quickly. However, please be aware that the integration does not work on all websites, and one thus has to manually create a masked email on Fastmail.com. I am certain they will work on adding more websites to support this feature in the future. I have been in contact with support about billing who responded within approx. 1-2 days and solved my problem fast and professionally. I think that is what you can expect - so well done. No review without something which can be improved or added: - An option to add a Fastmail email to a login when masked emails are created manually when the popup does not appear on the email field. All in all, I am happy with 1Password and the price is my optics reasonable.

title: Excellent Customer Support
text: I had an excellent experience with the 1Password Customer Support team. Specifically, Ixquel, Amy, and Sarabeth. These three seem to be a power team and I definitely believe they are assets to the 1Password organization. I reached out because I needed a credit from an old account switched over to my new account. I thought this would be impossible since it was tough to find a track-record of when I made the original transaction however they helped me and were able to credit my account. Thank you to these three and the support team for their help!

title: Excellent help with old version
text: When asking for help with upgrading from my old version of 1Password I got very accurate answer. I was especially happy with a very nice and helpful attitude.

title: Great 1Password customer support from Kevin Li.
text: I signed on to try 1Password and have been feeding it with my various sites and passwords. (I've had to feel my way in this process as -- at least from my point of view -- 1Password provides very little guidance for familiarizing oneself with its operations.) One site simply wouldn't operate reliably, and I took my problem to 1Password support. Fortunately, my query was assigned to Kevin Li, who immediately contacted me and worked with me to solve the problem. He prepared a short video about my sign-in procedure as I had explained it to him. I sent him a pdf with screenshots of each stage of the process to show what was going wrong. And -- Bingo! -- he hit the nail on the head regarding what I needed to do next to solve the problem. Kevin provided great customer support!

title: Of all the password storage utilities I've used, this one is the best
text: Of all the password storage utilities I have used, 1Password Password Manager has to be the best so far, and it keeps getting better. One suggestion I can offer is that the Android version needs to be less intrusive in "being so helpful". It's popup often overlays whatever it is you need to fill in, and because it is so fast to jump to your assistance, you often cannot see what it is offering to fill in without navigating away from the field and going back. Because of the limited screen real-estate on a phone screen, this can often be more of a hindrance than a help. On a PC screen or tablet screen, this is not an issue. I can turn this feature off entirely, but then I lose the benefit when I most need it. For now, I learn to adapt. I love the configurability of this application and the ability to store much more than just passwords. I keep track of what is in my wallet in case I lose it, what is in my safe deposit box, etc., membership cards, passport details. The list goes on for those things you can store in your personal vault. And because it is in the Cloud, it is always available to you with an Internet connection. I am a lifetime subscriber. My search for a reliable, comprehensive, and easy-to-master password keeper is over! I am sticking with 1Password.

When I discovered it and reached out to 1Password, they helped me make sure I didn't delete passwords from the wrong license and refunded my erroneous extra license.  Beyond the quality of the product, their service this time - and every time I have had to ask for help - has been flawless and fair.  I would recommend them for their product and for their ethical treatment (and the ease and quickness of the responses from the help desk).  Thank you very much!

title: New User Experience
text: I am a new user of 1Password. With over 600 passwords for my personal and business related activities and increasingly frequent notices of compromise, I spent considerable time researching the various options. I have worked in technology for many years as a developer, a head of development, a head of technology strategy, a CIO and CEO of four technology-intensive companies. As I started my journey in implementing 1Password I had some confusion and difficulty. I installed 1Password on my MacBook, iPad and iPhone, imported my existing passwords from iCloud (Keychain) and began to change passwords to iPassword suggested passwords site by site. However, I notice the platforms did not seem to be synching across devices. I requested help from 1Password‚Äôs support team. One of their agents (Alex) responded within 24 hours, providing step by step instructions and illustrations of how to make it all work. The instructions were perfect. Problem solved, and I am back on my way to migrating all of my passwords.  I don‚Äôt often write reviews (good or bad), but knowing the huge customer base that 1Password has, how quickly they responded and how personalized and accurate the guidance was, I sent them an email to thank them.  I am so glad I picked this product and company to trust for securing my passwords. They truly are outstanding.

title: Brilliant Password Manager with outstanding customer support
text: The headlines: 	1.	A brilliant password manager. It has always sync‚Äôd across all my devices effortlessly; 	2.	More knowledgeable people than me rate 1Password‚Äôd security as the best in the business; 	3.	It is a brilliant place for an individual a family or an organisation to keep important documents and all the stuff that Apple‚Äôs keychain can‚Äôt keep. 	4.	Has evolved over time to provide really useful features, beyond archiving log-ins. 	5.	Integrates with browsers really well  	6.	Will outlive me: the company is well financed and has a good roadmap into the future. 	7.	Most importantly, has provided me with ome of the best customer support I‚Äôve had in 35 years of working with IT. 1Password used to be a one-off purchase, but it has recently moved to a subscription model. I‚Äôve used it since 2013 and was reluctant and hesitant to move to the new model. But I knew I would have to do something: my old version won‚Äôt necessarily run on the next computer I get. I looked at many of the alternatives and they did not really match up. So I contacted 1Password about upgrading. The support they gave was brilliant: My questions were answered concisely and accurately within 24 hours; the instructions for transitioning that they they gave me were clear, easy to follow and ‚Äì the key thing ‚Äì they worked.    I have to say, I appreciate 1Password more today than I did 12 years ago.

title: IS&T Engineer // Highly Recommends 1Password
text: As a private IS&T engineer working worldwide, I can't recommend 1Password enough. I've been using the service and apps for nearly a decade, and I've never had a negative experience or hit a bug that wasn't acknowledged and fixed immediately. In the few times that I've needed assistance, Customer Care has been responsive, helpful, and engaged.  Managing several thousand passwords (for myself and clients) can get messy fast, but 1P makes it a breeze. Everything is kept tidy in one central place, with as much specificity as you need. The apps are reliable and well-integrated in macOS, iOS, and iPadOS (hello auto-fill for authenticator codes!). Add high-speed but secure encryption, and you have a product worth 10x what they charge. If you have a pulse, you need to manage passwords. If you haven't already, do yourself a favor and make life easier ‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì sign up for 1Password.

title: Excellent customer support and service
text: I have had 1Password since 2011. At that time I needed help getting it setup, but in all the time since then it has worked perfectly. I had it on my phone and my computer and used it constantly. Last week I decided to change all my passwords, and in the process I became aware that the stand-alone product I had used for over ten years was no longer supported by the company. I downloaded the new version, and somehow the two versions ended up tangled together. In order to pull them apart I needed a lot of help from Support, and I received it!!! I was so afraid that I would lose my old data in the process, but Support was there for me all the way through and made sure that I had what I needed to make the transition seamlessly. I cannot recommend 1Password too highly!!!

title: Moved to 1Password from LastPass after 10+ years
text: I've been a satisfied (paying) user of LastPass for over 10 years and generally I've been pleased with the product.  The security "incidents" you hear of are nearly all massively sensationalised and the applications work ok. 1Password though, is so much better - in every way! Apps (Windows and iOS at least) are much more refined and less "glitchy".  Clipboard management in Windows 10 is implemented perfectly (and securely), auto-fill seems to work better and doesn't get in the way as much, you can create custom entries with multiple "passwords", tags are great, TOTP integration (one-time passwords), watchtower service is neat and highlighted a few issues I needed to sort out ... the list goes on. I'm delighted with 1Password so far and I'd recommend any long-time LastPass users to take a look.  I imagine like me you'll be impressed and might even choose to switch yourself.

title: Switched to 1password families plan and love it!
text: My family have used 1password for years and loved it. Other family members have individual memberships, while I have an old standalone version of 1password that is not supported on any platforms anymore. So I contacted the 1password team for advice. Ethan was very friendly, knowledgeable and patient with all my questions. With his help, we decided to switch to 1password families plan. The data migration and integration between devices were super easy. 1password has thought through a lot of things to make transition painless. I like several features of the families plan. Everyone has secure access to their own private vault that nobody else can see, and we can create shared vaults to share information and decide who can see and edit it. If one person is locked out of his account, other family members can help him recover the account. The cost is lower for the  family plan than several individual plans combined. Also love how easy to use 1password on my ipad and iphone, and the sync among devices is instant.

I have actually sent emails to companies that they responded to weeks later. I never do business with a company that does not provide good customer support. I asked Melicia two initial questions and she responded within 15 minutes! My wife and I will be signing up for the two week trial either today or on Saturday. text: 1Password holds its customers peace of mind in their hands. Lose your passwords and your life is over! title: Amazing support
text: On an otherwise quiet winter weekend morning, I changed a password and managed to lock myself out of my 1Password account. (Trust me, this is not that easy to do.) I contacted the support desk, thinking they could help retrieve the  new password... but as one would, of course, hope and expect of a company dedicated to password security, they never have a record of any passwords used by customers. It turned out there *was* a way to rescue my data, but the process involved multiple steps, and I have multiple devices, so it took a little time. The support I received throughout was AMAZING. Above and beyond, and beyond that. 1Password has been an indispensable time-saver and security-booster for me, and it's great to know they have such great people able to help when you need it. So impressed.

text: By some error my membership was cancelled with 1Password. Although I paid the yearly amount.  After contacting 1Password about the problem I was delighted to know the immediate response and the matter was corrected without delay with an apology.   Not only this but I was offered a complimentary 12 months free membership.  The service was friendly without any delay and I can heartily recommend 1Password with I have used for many years without any problems.  Yours sincerely  Gunnel Karel

title: 1Password Review
text: I have been using 1Password from the very beginning and it is great that they continue to evolve it. It is a critical part of how I maintain my security on the internet. I was initially quite wary about the subscription based pivot they made a few years back but have come to appreciate it. As a family it is very convenient to have shared vaults and simple syncing across users and devices.

title: Improvements to Online Customer Service
text: Once I got 1Password up and running it was easy to use, but the initial steps were difficult. This is because your Q&A and Help sections of the website are high level - they tell you how to set up 1Password and why you'd want to use it; but I needed to know simple operations - such as how to delete a password. So your Q&A might look like this: Q: How do I delete a password from my imported list (in Windows)? A. Passwords are deleted by a right click on their names. If you are unable to right click it is because you haven't yet downloaded iPasswords to your computer. Downloading enables many more functions than are available in the Web version. Q. How do I find my secret key? Your secret key will automatically download to your computer when you sign up. Look in your download folder to access and save it. I don't believe there is a "Help" button on every page of 1Passworrd but there should be. You're Canadians! The helpful people!

title: The customer service team was so‚Ä¶
text: The customer service team was so helpful, quick and easy to communicate with. It was so refreshing getting real responses from real people instead of canned responses that don‚Äôt actually help me with my specific issue. Thank you!

I look forward to learning more and more of the services 1Password now is providing.  I would strongly recommend it to those who have hundreds of passwords to those who have only a few.  Thank You.

The app works well but without live customer service when there are problems i wouldn‚Äôt rate it higher than 3 stars. They need real time solutions for problems. Days to respond to emails is not user friendly for an app you pay for. I have the family plan and not one of my invitees were able to successfully join my family plan after 11 months of service. If there were live customer care to help they‚Äôd be able to use what I pay for.
