title: Amazing App! Legitimately SUPERB Customer Service.
text: First, I need to say that I absolutely love 1Password which I have been using back in the day when it was still free and did not even require a subscription. Last year, I thought I'd get my parents to use 1Password and so I subscribed to the family plan. However, a year went by and they did not use it much because they still preferred the old pen/paper method and adding additional technology/software into their daily routines is not something they were very interested in. I must note though that my mother said she really found the app to be easy to use and quite neat given that it can sync across devices along with having such high-level security - she most definitely understood why it was my preferred choice of password storage. While it was not a good feeling to have to switch from a family to an inidvidual personal account, I must say that the 1Password Customer Service team made it extremely easy for me to do so. Yes, I could have done it on my own online but it was not about that. They answered every single one of my questions, reclarified when I was not clear on a response, and their responses were very prompt. I might also add that they continue to respond during odd hours of the day like at 2 AM which is definitely outside of business hours - because they CARE. When I am storing such important information in an app, I want to know that if something happens, I can get help that is both effective and quick. My experience started with Ronan Lyver who really went above and beyond in multiple ways, trying to make the experience as great as it could be for me including ways to save money. Considering that I reached out on a Friday afternoon, we had six back-and-forth emails before Ronan's colleague Kaley took over with a very easy transition (knowing everything that Ronan and I had spoken about without asking me to rehash the situation all over again). Kaley's response came to me at 11:25 PM EST! She also went above and beyond, introducing me to specific offers to make 1Password even more affordable for me. These savings accumulate and are well appreciated, but they offered these to me without me even having to ask about other ways to save money. A company that does this is a true testament to the fact that they care more about the customer experience than their company and it is those companies that succeed! In my last encounter before my question was fully answered/issue resolved, I was transferred to Saif Ahmad who provided me with the tools/instructions needed. I have interacted with so many customer service representatives and 1Password's CS team STANDS OUT! I can honestly continue to type for hours but I think you get the point from everything I have written so far. Thanks so much Ronan, Kaley, Saif and the 1Password team!

title: Everything in one place!

title: I chose 1Password Manager to give me peace of mind.
text: I signed up for 1Password as the generic password that I'd established some years ago for accessing general sites that didn't require their own unique high security passwords was hacked. Unfortunately, they also hacked my email account where they then scanned my emails and redeemed a gift voucher given to me only the day prior. When I went to use it, I found that it had already been redeemed. This confirmed that I needed to finally choose a professional password system to manage access to the web sites that I visit. After several reviews, I chose 1Password Manager.  As an older person, not conversant with setting up new systems, and after a less than successful start, I enlisted the help of one of my daughter's and its all gone smoothly since. It's a fairly easy system to use, and a few days later, I'm very happy knowing that my system is now secure - I should have done this years ago but like many, I procrastinated! 1Password gives 7 days free access to try it out, so give it a go. Like me, I'm sure you'll be impressed. Allan in Australia.

title: Great and smooth migration from V6 to V7 family account and great support
text: After having used 1Password(V6) for many years, as a standalone app synching it with iCloud, I decided to migrate to a Family account so I can build shared folders for my spouse and family members.  Messing with all my passwords and migrating was a somewhat scary thought for me. What if ....things go wrong ?  I looked at the migration video provided by 1password on their website and it all seemed so simple. With the necessary precautions I signed up for a trial version and started the process. Before I could blink my eyes it was over 1Password told me that all my 'old vault items' were migrated to the new account based vault.  I was skeptical, 'this was all too smooth' and I thought something had gone wrong as I had anticipated.  But I WAS WRONG !! THE WHOLE PROCESS WAS SMOOTH and everything was nicely copied over in a matter of seconds and I could start to use the new account based vault.  Also adding other devices like iPad, iPhone and Iwatch was easy by just following the instructions.  So time to create some shared vaults place a few items in it and invite other family members.  My spouse already had her own iCloud based vault (V6) and also this was migrated to the family account in a matter of seconds leaving her nicely with her own private vault in the family account and the few items I had already put in the shared vault.  So all in all great and smooth transition. After this experience I decided to fully subscribe to the service and provide my credit card details for payment but I still had 1 question left so before doing so I decided to contact Support by sending an email not expecting and email soon as it was very early in the morning USA time. Much to my suprise the response was prompt and very correct offering an immediate solution to my question.  So a after a great migration experience I now also had a GREAT SUPPORT experience. I'm not a big fan of subscription based services but sometimes one has to recognize that for a company to be able to deliver good products and service it is required to make some money. THIS IS ONE OF THOSE SITUATIONS.

title: Take Ownership of Your Digital Identity
text: Increasingly your digital space is merging to become one in the same as the physical space. Services like 1Password help you responsibly secure and use that space. I first was introduced to 1Password, after reading an article in Wired about how a Wired writer by means of social engineering, common passwords across multiple platforms, and not using two factor authentication had his entire digital world erased. His Google Drive, Gmail, iCloud, laptop, iPhone, and iPad were all locked or erased by the hacker. He lost photos of his children that he had no longer copies of, something that was priceless. Why all this? Because the hackers wanted his OG Twitter handle @mat. In that moment I knew that every website I used in the future had to have its own password. Flash forward four years, I now use 1Password for all my passwords and important docs. Every password is the maximum length and complexity the website or service allows for, since I'm not typing it why do I care.  The passwords used simply cannot be broken through brute force by today's computers within my lifetime. 1Password allowed me to step up my game when it comes to personal digital security without having to give up any convenience offer by Apple's keychain and Safari auto-fill. In fact as soon as the OS allowed for it, I completely disabled auto fill from keychain based passwords and deleted all password records in it.  As the digital space evolved, so has 1Password. I now use their Canadian based service that deliberately creates guardrails in where my information is stored and by whom it can be accessed should I need support. 1Password took the requirements of GDPR and turned them into an asset.  1Password makes me feel safe and confident that my PII is secure and yet accessible to me whenever I need it.

text: I've tried more than a few password managers now and by far my preferred is 1password. Some of the things that have impressed me: a) Rock-solid browser extension. Getting the tick of approval from the other half is always a major factor when it comes to a password manager. c) Support. When I first signed up for a trial, I had the bad luck of my computer power supply finally dying after 8 years of service. 1Password support happily extended the trial. And again when I was convinced enough to purchase support was happy to help bring me on board.  It's as perfect a service as I've seen for password managers and I have no doubts around the security of the service - and am doubly happy there's no tracking baked in.  Very pleased with this purchase, and can highly recommend.

text: Fantastic password manager with amazing features. I have been an active user for several years, starting prior to the subscription model. title: I've been using the 1Password's‚Ä¶
text: I've been using the 1Password's standalone version for many years.  I just moved to its subscription-based version for me and my family.  One of the reasons is I don't want to rely on Dropbox for data syncing any more. Generally speaking, the subscription version is more or less the same as the standalone version, but including some new features.  Some are good and some aren't.    Actually, before I moved to the subscription service, I did researches on similar products and tried them as well.  All of them have pros and cons.   I finally chose 1Password as it is more user-friendly to me, although its price is a bit higher than others. One thing I should mention, even though to some of the questions (due to the changing from standalone to subscription-based) I raised in 1Password Support Forum were not answered satisfactorily.  The people there did try their best and patiently to explain to me why they are what they are.  That's good customer service. I give it 4 stars because it doesn't 100% meeting my personal needs, and there are really rooms for improvement.

title: Great support and prompt response from‚Ä¶

title: I really appreciate your service‚Ä¶
text: I really appreciate your service department. The help provided is always thoughtful and knowledgeable and pertains to the situation at hand. While most helpdesks will regurgitate template responses, 1Password issues responses that fit the situation. If these are templates, they are extremely well done and your staff is knowledgeable enough about the product that the answer always fits.. Well done.

title: solved problem and let me continue‚Ä¶
text: solved problem and let me continue trial after some teething issues, handed issues between colleagues well too. very good overall

title: Exceptional product and support. Very impressed! Dump Dashlane!
text: Decided to try 1Password after Dashlane was starting to have reliability issues. 1Password's latest version outperforms Dashlane by a huge margin. It is intuitive, reliably saves passwords every single time, it is very flexible, and works flawlessly across my many Mac devices. I did have a minor hiccup when my trial was ending, as my Family Account was set up as a separate account from the trial. However, I was able to export my trial password entries into a text file, and then import them into my Family Account, and that worked flawlessly. I needed some help with some of this from your support center, but they were amazingly good, and they seem to work around the clock. I have never had such incredible support from any software company. By the way, Dashlane's export function DOES NOT WORK at all! That created some work, but it was worth it to upgrade my password tools to a world class product.

title: I've been having issues with the‚Ä¶
text: I've been having issues with the 1Password App on my Mac each time there's a new MacOS update where the OS update would invariably "break" the 1Password App on my Mac. The most recent was this week when Apple realized the OS BigSur 11.3 update. I've reached out to 1Password and the next morning Tommy Hightower responded and took the time to find out why those issues were happening on my end. When he discovered the cause/root of the problem, he sent me a step-by-step direction on how to rectify the situation. I've been using the services of 1Password for a few years and have found them to have excellent customer service and very quick turnaround time on their responses. Thanks for being so reliable and easy to work with! Dr. D

title: I have been using 1password for a few‚Ä¶
text: I have been using 1password for a few years now, it‚Äôs saved me a great deal of a hassle as I use multiple devices. For me, it was a change in my mindset to have ‚Äú someone else‚Äù set my password, password that are actually hard to remember. And  now - I really don‚Äôt have to remember any passwords!!  I did run into some issues and support was very prompt and helpful.

title: 1Password excels in customer service!
text: When I made the switch to a password manager years ago, I did my research and chose 1Password, and I'm glad I did. Every contact I've had with the company has been super easy, always pleasant and always helpful. Recently I upgraded to 1Password 7 from 6. I needed to understand a few things before I proceeded. I got a quick response, combined with even a special offer I had missed. My expectations from the beginning would be that 1Password would be an outstanding password manager which it is. I'm blown away by the customer service! This is a very good company!

title: Used this app for years without issue
text: Used this app for years without issue.  Loved it, in fact.  NOW, I'm forced to PAY for the once free service and it won't even run on my Mac as advertised.  Everything seems poorly coded and now has the worst user experience I have EVER had.  Wasted my money.  You STOLE my money and gave me #$%$ in return. STOP USING AGILE. UPDATE:  Thank you for your standardized response.  You see, I was willing to give the cloud a go, but it simply doesn‚Äôt work.  I would very much like for the things I pay for to work.  It‚Äôs like someone selling me a car, promising 4 wheels and only delivering a shell with 3 wheels.  Not acceptable.  DEFINITELY reportable to the BBB.  Funny how the payment process went without a hitch.  Hmmm. I did have a FREE version of this software for YEARS.  I know this because I know I never paid for it.  Now you‚Äôre just scamming everyone.  And whatever happened to the customer being right?  Did you throw that out the window with your morals and good coding practice? You took an otherwise decent product and $ucked it up. UPDATE:  You can't even get put in the slammer because you hide in some other country.  I still haven't heard back from your supposed customer support - it's been hours.  So much for that path.  Yup.  Take people's money and run.  That's the way 1Password prefers to do business.  You'll start losing customers pretty quickly once they catch on.  Trust me.  No one wants to be scammed.

title: Should have done this years earlier
text: I‚Äôve been postponing the transition from the old standalone 1Password4 to the 1Password subscription for many years. Because I was afraid to do something wrong and to loose my passwords. Thanks to the support team the transition was a breeze. The subscription is a breeze as well. So easy to use and convenient. Thanks support team!

text: Stellar, always helpful support. Been using 1Password for years and I can't complain about anything!

title: Great software

title: Superb support and a very rapid‚Ä¶
text: Superb support and a very rapid response.  Arguably all my questions would have been answered by research (support boards, documentation) but I am a lazy reader of such things.  Nothing stopped 1P support from very comprehensive response, clearly explained, often with examples and further suggestions for great safety and efficiency.  Simply could not recommend 1P highly enough

title: Pen and paper don‚Äôt cut it any more
text: In a technological world, one cannot manage effectively with pen and paper when it comes to keeping track of the hundreds of passwords most of us have collected. The number one complaint when I talk to my friends and acquaintances about ‚Äútechnology‚Äù and ‚Äúcomputers‚Äù is (yes,) keeping track of passwords. I cringe inwardly when I see users with notebooks full of passwords, crossed out and scribbled over repeatedly. There is an better, tidier and secure method. Quite simply, you have a phone or a computer. Use them to do the work for you. 1Password is a superb solution to this password maintenance issue. It‚Äôs easy to use and gives you peace of mind that your passwords are as secure as you can make them.  I‚Äôve tried other password storage applications to see what they offer and although the others I‚Äôve tried are good, there is nothing I‚Äôve tested that deals with password security and storage as well as 1Password. A little research and reading of reviews will show you that it is almost always the first recommendation of the reviewer. I use it along with Apple‚Äôs Keychain and find the two work very well together.  It‚Äôs all about security. I frequently follow various articles on general password maintenance and security from AgileBits and I‚Äôve always found valuable information therein. I often go back to them to see what has changed since I last read them.  AgileBits has great online help and support. I also recommend a book ‚ÄúTake Control of 1Password‚Äù by Joe Kissel if you would like a guide to help you with 1Password. For travellers, check out Travel Mode, the ability of 1Password to protect your 1Password data from unwarranted searches. It‚Äôs ideal for business people who have access to certain keys, services, or any sensitive information and can‚Äôt afford to take any risks with others seeing those things. One more thing. 1Password was founded in Canada.

title: I wanted to change my account from‚Ä¶
text: I wanted to change my account from family to single. Every email I sent was answered very quickly and was very helpful. It needed a couple of attempts for me to get it right (my fault) but every query I made was answered quickly and politely. The service was excellent  I use 1Password every day for all of my passwords and I am up to 229 entries - so without these guys I would be totally lost!!  Overall - well done!

title: A REAL person with a REAL name
text: I really love the software, and am thrilled that I can now organize everything.  But, the best part is that when I asked a question, I received a response from a REAL person, with a REAL name, not an awful a automated response. Ashly asked if she could help with anything else, and I responded: "No, but I really do appreciate very much that you took the time to actually deal with me as a real human being - so many time, I get automated emails that are meaningless, so this is very different - a real person is responding!! Thank you, Ashley - have a nice afternoon/evening!"

title: If you don't trust your browser's‚Ä¶
text: If you don't trust your browser's password manager and you tire of the monotonous task of leafing through a (reporter's) notebook for login information, then 1Password is for you.  After watching a couple videos on Youtube, I was able to set up the basic login information.  Getting the extension to work in Firefox did not work right away and this is where 1Password's customer support really shined.  Within a couple hours (or less) I had a reply that solved the problem post haste--I was up and running on Firefox.  And what a joy it was to just click on auto fill in 1Password for the login information--no more typing long passwords and hoping there wasn't a typo.  They also extended my trial period so I could have enough time on Firefox to evaluate the software--that is good customer service! I still have more to learn, but I am confident that the software is safe and that it will live up to all their claims.

text: I wanted to update to 1Password 7 as I was having problems with the older version that I have been using for 8 years.  I asked for help via e mail.  First Jason replied with advice on how to proceed.  After several unsuccessful attempts to transition to version 7, I asked for advice again.  This time Intan replied right away.  After several more e mail exchanges, I got version 7 working perfectly and it is a huge leap forward from the older one.  I can't thank Jason and Intan enough for the amount of time they spent helping me (a 72 year old retired, not so computer savvy, Cdn Forces vet). I salute their patience, professionalism and courtesy.  I highly recommend 1Password 7.  Ken

title: Have tried Lastpass and NordPass‚Ä¶ this wins hands down
text: Have tried Lastpass and NordPass previously, and ended up with 1Password. Yes it's a paid plan but the sync is great and secure, the native Mac app is great (the keyboard shortcut with the invisible login plus authenticating via touch ID is great)  and the Android app is great too. The ability to store TFA codes is great too, by definition it's a bit insecure having synced/non-local two factor, but for ease of use... it's just that extra step.  At one point I had an issue with Android not suggesting logins for browsers straightaway, so I emailed support expecting them to get back to me in a week... had a reply 30 mins later, and after a few back-and-forths it was sorted within an hour of my initial email. So quick! Her name was Amber and she was great. Toootally recommend. Love it!

title: Application Update
text: Application Update: I had a problem downloading the update and the tech person worked me through the process troubleshooting until it worked!
